story:
The Mantis Garden project is a community driven art initiative that combines the power of the creative process with the artistic potential inherent in all communities. Project Lead Gaetan Spurgin has harnessed  the raw power of organic symbolism and is focused on reinvesting it in the artistic community from which he draws so much inspiration. With nearly three years of artistic energy and psychic fuel built up since the first Mantis was cut, the Mantis Garden installation hopes to expand the reach of the artistic community by producing art that moves within it.

The Mantis sculptures are hand crafted, one by one, with individual events, festivals and celebrations in mind. Mantis sculptures travel to their destinations and are decorated freely by event patrons and community members. This provides each Mantis with their own intangible identity that reflects the mood and atmosphere of each gathering while drawing all communities involved with the Mantis Garden together. 

As the garden grows with fresh art over time, the culmination of the project will see all the Mantii brought together in celebration of Love, Life and Artistic Expression, drawing together the inspirations from people all over the world into one sacred space created for personal spiritual and emotional healing.


This is the 1st Phase of our project. We are constructing the Mantii in varying sizes and bringing the finished wooden sculptures to music and art festivals with penchants for extremely positive and therapeutic communities.

We'll bring the cut, stained and primed sculptures to these events and then provide art materials free of charge to anyone who wants to decorate them. We provide a calming and safe space to experiement creatively and contribute to a community project.

PHASE 1 SCHEDULE:

June 24-28 Playa del Fuego, Odessa, Delaware

June 24-28 Country Club, Catskills, New York

June 9-10 Figment New York, Governor's Island, New York City

June 15-18 Freeform Festival, Salem, New Jersey

June 29-July 3 Philadelphia Experiment Summer Festival, Ramblewood, Maryland

July 20-23 Transformus, North Carolina

After the Summer 2012 season concludes, we'll be bringing all of our sculptures to the Burning Man arts forum in Nevada, where we believe our sacred art installation will provide peace and therapeutic respite from the harsh and emotional environment.


(Gaetan with the Egg Chamber, his visionary sonic peace chamber and the recipient of a PEXFest 2011 art grant, at Burning Man in 2011)

Phase 2 begins as soon as we finish decompressing from our summer arts tour. We will use the completed Mantis Garden Project and any remaining resources to begin campaigning for a community arts initiative based on art therapy. 

Functionally, we will raise funds using our art installation to cover the costs of art supplies and transport, then take our creations to schools, hospitals, prisons, anywhere people are in need of a therapeutic expression of their own creativity. We hope to provide these services to impoverished youth and underpriveleged adults alike. While the arts community has been our guiding influence over the course of the project, we hope to provide a truly powerful healing experience for people who have lived their entire lives without ever having the opportunity to express themselves. 

The Mantis Garden Project is a labor of love, with special dedications to:

The Space Pirates (Philadelphia)
The Philadelphia Experiment (Philadelphia)
Disorient (New York/California)
Black Rock Arts Foundation (Nevada) 

and finally we wish to commit this artistic vision in loving memory of

                  Gary Lee Spurgin

                         1938-2012

story:
Gruender-Garage 2012 - WINNERS

Quelle: Indiegogo Garage Winners

 

DIE PERKS FÜR UNTERNEHMEN SIND FREIGEGEBEN!

 

 

Die deutsche Version steht weiter unten!

 

1. Like-it.

2. Tweet it.

3. G+1 it.

4. Embed the code.

5. Email your friends.

 

Currency Converter

Währungsrechner - umrechner-euro.de

€1,- = $1,27 (September, 11th 2012)

 

GoEsteem is an art project to join in for people who cherish themselves, each other and the world.

The concept was born by me, Petra Schmitt. I am a Berlin based artist and Dipl.-Ing. architect. I as well as many others live a green lifestyle. We love cherish ourselves, each other and the environment. And we love to spread the word about giving esteem.
GoEsteem is a great possibility for everyone to show what's good in life. And to have fun sharing it by taking part of creating the symbol of a better world with a simple picture upload. The pictures will be combined automatically to a large worldmap mosaic.


How it shall work

  1. Take a picture of a good step in life you want to be cherished for.
  2. Show the pic at the worldmap on www.goesteem.com
  3. Get esteem for it, make new friends and invite old ones to join the project.
  4. See the worldmap of good steps grow and be proud of being part of this symbol of a better world.

 

What are good steps I can take pictures of that I can show on GoEsteem?

You could take a picture of

  • your feed while your're walking instead of taking the car. This is healthy and good for the environment. It saves CO2.
  • your vegetarian meal. This also is healthy and it saves a lot of ressources.
  • the next party in your urban-gardening project. This would show how people have fun using the urban space.
  • how pretty you look like using the non-animal-tested cosmetic products you use.

 

Some samples of good steps:


So, it does not work yet as you can see on my website. To make it work I need, besides the time to make it run, ...


What I need

... €500,-  for paying the programmer to get run the worldmap-picture-upload-interaction.
It would be really great if you could give €100,-, €50,-, €20,-, €10,- or just €1,-. You'll get a perk for it!


What you get

ESTEEM OF COURSE!!!
The €1,- Perk: You get esteem on the GoEsteem-Facebook and GoEsteem-Twitter Account.
The €10,- Perk: You get the €1,- Perk plus your name on www.goesteem.com as a supporter.
The €20,- Perk: You get the €10,- Perk plus a postcardset with the worldmap print.
The €50,- Perk: You get the €10,- Perk plus a small artprint on canvas of the GoEsteem worldmap.


Other Ways You Can Help

I would appreciate also to get this kind of support:

  • Spread the word and tell your friends about this campaign.
  • Visit www.facebook.com/goesteem, like it and become a friend.
  • Invite your Facebook friends to join in.
  • Visit and follow www.twitter.com/go_esteem
  • Tell your Twitter friends to take part.
  • Share on any other network you're in.
  • Mention GoEsteem in your blog.
  • Watch the GoEsteem videos on www.vimeo.com/goesteem 

 

 

Scroll to the top for the English version!

 

1. Like-it.

2. Tweete.

3. G+1 es.

4. Klicke embed.

5. Maile deinen Feunden.

GoEsteem ist ein Kunstprojekt zum Mitmachen für alle, die sich selbst, andere Menschen und die Welt wertschätzen.

Das Konzept ist von mir. Ich heiße Petra Schmitt und ich lebe und arbeite als Künstlerin und Dipl.-Ing. Architektin in Berlin. Ich und viele andere hier haben einen grünen Lebensstil. Wir wertschätzen uns selbst, andere und die Welt.
GoEsteem ist eine großartige Möglichkeit für jeden, zu zeigen, was es bedeutet, ein gutes Leben zu leben, und Spaß dabei zu haben. Durch die Teilnahme an diesem Projekt wird durch einfaches Hochladen von Bildern das Symbol einer besseren Welt entstehen. Viele Einzelbilder, auf denen gute Taten im realen Leben zu sehen sind, werden automatisch zu einer Weltkarte zusammen gesetzt.



Wie soll das gehen?

  1. Fotografiere einen Schritt in deinem Leben, für den du geschätzt werden willst.
  2. Zeig das Foto auf der Weltkarte auf www.goesteem.com
  3. Bekomme Wertschätzung, lerne neue Freunde kennen und lade alte ein, an diesem Projekt teilzunehmen.
  4. Sieh dabei zu, wie sich die Weltkarte immer weiter mit guten Lebensentscheidungen füllt und sei stolz darauf, ein Teil davon zu sein.

Welche guten Schritte kann ich fotografieren und auf GoEsteem zeigen?

Du könntest zum Beispiel

  • deine Füße fotografieren, wenn du zu Fuß gehst, statt das Auto zu benutzen. Das ist gesund und gut für die Umwelt. Es spart CO2.
  • dein vegetarisches Mittagessen fotografieren. Das ist auch gesund und spart eine Menge Ressourcen.
  • die nächste Party in deinem Urban-Gardening Projekt fotografieren. Das würde zeigen, wie sich Menschen Lebensraum zu eigen machen und Spaß haben.
  • fotografieren, wie schön du mit der tierversuchsfreien Kosmetik aussiehst, die du benutzt.

Ein paar Beispiele für gute Schritte:

 

Wie du auf meiner Webseite sehen kannst, siehst du noch nichts. Die Seite funktioniert noch nicht. Neben der Zeit, die für die Programmierung nötig ist, brauche ich auch Geld, um sie zum Laufen zu bringen.


Was ich brauche

Ich brauche €500, um den Programmierer dafür zu bezahlen, die Interaktivität mit der Weltkarte zu programmieren, damit du dein Foto an der Stelle zeigen kannst, an der du es zeigen willst.
Ich würde mich sehr freuen, wenn du von diesen €500,- entweder €100,-, €50,-, €20,-, €10,- oder auch nur €1,- spenden würdest. Du bekommst auch ein kleines Dankeschön dafür.


Was du dafür bekommst

WERTSCHÄTZUNG NATÜRLICH!!!
Der €1,- Dankeschön-Perk: Du wirst als UnterstützerIn des Projekts auf dem GoEsteem-Facebook und dem GoEsteem-Twitter Account wertgeschätzt.
Der €10,- Dankeschön-Perk: Du bekommst den €1,- Perk und eine namentliche Erwähnung auf www.goesteem.com als UnterstützerIn des Projekts.
Der €20,- Dankeschön-Perk: Du bekommst den €10,- Perk und ein Postkartenset mit dem Aufdruck der GoEsteem Weltkarte.
Der €50,- Dankeschön-Perk: Du bekommst den €10,- Perk und einen kleinen Kunstdruck der GoEsteem Weltkarte auf Leinwand.



Andere Möglichkeiten der Unterstützung

Auch über diese Form der Hilfe wäre ich sehr dankbar:

  • Erzähl deinen Freunden von dieser Kampagne.
  • Besuch mich auf www.facebook.com/goesteem, klick den like-it Button und werde ein Facebook-Freund von GoEsteem.
  • Lade deine Facebook-Freunde ein, Freunde von GoEsteem zu werden.
  • Folge GoEsteem auf www.twitter.com/go_esteem.
  • Lade deine Twitter-Freunde ein, GoEsteem zu folgen.
  • Teile GoEsteem auf allen anderen Netzwerken, in denen du aktiv bist.
  • Erwähne GoEsteem in deinem Blog.
  • Sieh dir die GoEsteem Videos auf www.vimeo.com/goesteem an.

Also, falls wir hier doch ein Impressum brauchen, was ja nicht ganz klar war. Hier ist eins: Impressum

Da ich hier bei Indiegogo keine eigene Seite dafür anlegen kann, habe ich das Impressum einfach auf einer Seite von GoEsteem hinterlegt, bis die Frage, ob wir eins brauchen und wenn ja, wie es hier integriert werden kann, geklärt ist.

story:
«La Forêt des Hespérides»

Une performance, alliant art équestre, cirque, danse, création sonore, et environnement illuminé, prenant place dans un coin de forêt des Appalaches. Il s’agit d’une création unique, un moment de magie éphémère qui veut emporter le spectateur hors des sentiers battus, pour une expérience poétique et sensorielle à la fois intime et sans précédent.

 

A performance, allying equestrian art, circus, dance, musical performance, and enlighten environment, taking place in a piece of the Appalachian forest. It is about a unique creation, one moment of short-lived magic, wanting to bring the spectators off the main path, for a poetical and sensorial experiment, as much intimate as unprecedented.

 

Inspiration et description du projet

Dans la mythologie grecque, les Hespérides  sont les nymphes du Couchant, On en compte traditionnellement trois. Elles résident dans un verger fabuleux, le jardin des Hespérides, situé à la limite occidentale du monde. Héra leur avait donné pour tâche de veiller sur les pommes d'or du jardin des Hespérides qu'elle leur avait confiés, et leur avait pour cela adjoint l'aide du dragon Ladon.

La recherche poétique s’articule autour du mythe de la «Femme-Arbre», créature imaginaire, mythique et symbolique, Fées-Esprit de la Forêt, qu’évoquent les Hespérides. Un spectacle sera sensible, tout en féminité et en grâce, peuplé d’images fortes et symboliques, mais aussi avec une part d’humour. Les personnages vont tantôt se confondre aux arbres, tantôt émerger du paysage sous des traits plus humains, à d’autres moments encore, sembler de purs esprits éthérés.

Les protagonistes de ce moment unique seront Caroline Rochefort, danseuse, acrobate aérienne et voltigeuse équestre; Hélène Leveau, équilibriste et acrobate sur corde molle; Marie-Claude Bouillon, cavalière et dresseuse équestre, accompagnées de trois chevaux de spectacle. La musique sera créée en direct par Maïeul Clairefond à l’aide de différents objets sonores suspendus aux arbres, et d’une basse électrique.

 

Le projet prendra forme dans une forêt mixte qui touche au cœur du village de Notre-Dame-du-Rosaire, dans le Parc des Appalaches. Une installation artistique y prendra vie : accrochage de voiles et de tissus aériens, d’objets sonores et de différents objets lumineux. La performance se déroulera dans cet espace féérique, au coucher du soleil. Le site sera accessible à pied par un chemin partant du village même, grâce à un sentier lumineux. Trois représentations seront offertes, les 29, 30 et 31 aout (reprise le 1er septembre en cas de pluie)

 

Pour les quatre artistes impliqués, ce sera une première de jouer en dehors de la piste, d’un chapiteau ou d’une salle. Nous sommes convaincus que la forêt va nous imprégner, influencer la création, et qui sait, devenir un cinquième personnage!

 

 

Inspiration and description of the project

In the ancient Greek mythology, Hesperides are the three nymphs of the Sunset. They live in a fabulous orchard, the Garden of Hesperides, located in the western limit of the world. Hera had given them the task of guarding and protecting the golden apples of the Garden of Hesperides, and offered them for this task the assistance of the dragon Ladon.

 

The poetical research is articulated around the myth of the "Tree-Woman", the mythical and symbolic creature, Fairies-spirit of the Forest, whom evoke Hesperides. The performance will be sensitive, elaborated with feminity and grace, filled with strong and symbolic images, but also with a part of humor. The characters will sometimes be metamorphosed in trees, sometimes emerging  from the landscape under more human features, sometimes acting like pure ethereal spirits.

 

The protagonists of this unique moment will be Caroline Rochefort, a dancer, aerialist and equestrian voltigeuse; Hélène Leveau, looserope walker and equilibrist; Marie-Claude Bouillon, equestrian trainer and rider, accompanied with three circus horses. The music will be created live by Maïeul Clairefond, with his electric bass and various sound objects suspended from trees.

 

The project will take place in a forest that touches the heart of the village of Notre-Dame-du-Rosaire, in the Park of Appalachians. An artistic installation will take life there: suspended veils and aerial silk, musical objects and various enlightments. The performance will occur in this magical space, at sunset. The site will be accessible by foot by an enlighten path from the village. Three representations will be offered on August 29, 30 and 31th.

For the four artists involved, it will be a completely new experience. We are convinced that the forest is going to fill us, to influence the creation, and who knows, to become the fifth character!

 

Qui est derrière ce projet?            Who is behind this project?

Marie-Claude Bouillon

Artiste visuelle diplômée de l’université Laval, mais aussi cavalière depuis plus de 20 ans, Marie-Claude s’est formée aux arts équestres au Canada, en France et au Portugal, auprès de maîtres reconnus du cirque et de la Haute École. Son approche des chevaux se fait dans le calme et la douceur, dans une recherche constante de la légèreté des aides et de la compréhension profonde de la nature du cheval. Pour elle, le cirque est un art total, éphémère. Elle s’intéresse à l’esthétique des spectacles, costumes, personnages, recherche et scénographie. Marie-Claude est l’idéatrice du projet.

Visual artist graduate from Laval University, but also dressage rider for more than 20 years, Marie-Claude has been formed in the equestrian arts in Canada, in France and in Portugal, with recognized masters of the circus and Haute École. Her approach of horses is made of calm and sweetness, in a constant search for the lightness and for the deep understanding of the nature of the horse. For her, the circus is a total, living art. She is interested in the aesthetics of the spectacles, costumes, characters, research, writing and scenography. Marie-Claude is the «idéatrice» of the project.

 

Caroline Rochefort

Diplômée du programme de danse contemporaine de l’Université Concordia, elle a complété sa formation de danseuse à New York et en Argentine. Elle a découvert le monde du cirque durant ces études et a décidé de se spécialiser en arts aériens et en voltige équestre. Elle a par la suite suivi différentes formations dans ces deux disciplines au Québec et à l’étranger (France, Irlande). C’est maintenant dans les airs ou à dos de cheval qu’elle exprimer ses passions.

Graduated from the program of contemporary dance of Concordia University, she completed her dancer's formation in New York and in Argentina. She discovered the circus during these studies and decided to specialize in aerial disciplines and in equestrian voltige (bareback and roman riding). She did various training courses in these two disciplines in Quebec and in Europe (France, Ireland). It is now in the airs or on horseback that she express her passions!

 

Hélène Leveau

Jeune circassienne aux talents multiples, Hélène est diplômée de Châtellerault en France, et vient de terminer son DEC à l’École de Cirque de Québec. Outre la corde molle et les équilibres, elle pratique également l’antipodisme et les jeux icariens. Elle confectionne des masques et des marionnettes, en plus de jouer du saxophone soprano.

Young Circassian with many talents, Hélène graduated from the Châtellerault school in France, and has just obtained her DEC from Québec’s Circus school. Besides the loose rope and the balances, she also practises antipodisme and icariens games). She makes masks and puppets, besides playing soprano saxophone.

 

Maïeul Clairefond

Né à Marseille (France), il est diplômé du Music Academy International de Nancy et de l’école de musique d’Arles, puis s’est formé à différents types de percussions notamment en Inde et au Brésil. Musicien, bassiste, mais aussi guitariste, flûtiste, percussionniste et compositeur; il aime associer sa musique à d'autres formes d'art (théâtre, cirque, danse, musique de films) tout en privilégiant les rencontres et les rapports humains, ce qui lui permet de travailler avec des artistes des quatre coins de la planète.... Sa feuille de route est aussi hétéroclite que prestigieuse.

Born in Marseille (France), he graduated from the International Music Academy of Nancy, and the Arles’ music school, then formed to various types of rhythms and percussions in India and in Brazil. Musician, bass player, but also guitarist, flutist, percussionist and composer; he deeply enjoy associating his music with other forms of art like theater, circus, dance or films… while favoring the encounter between human beings and different cultures, what allows him to work with artists from all around the world. His road sheet is as well heterogeneous as prestigious.

 

Ce dont nous avons besoin et à quoi vont servir vos dons.

Il s’agit d’un projet hors norme, qui ne sera joué ni en salle, ni sous chapiteau, mais en plein cœur de la nature, loin des grands centres. Conséquemment, d’une part, nous avons besoin de faire connaitre le projet afin que le public vienne assister aux représentations, et d’autre part, il n’y aura pas de billetterie. Nous voulons que ces prestations soient ouvertes à tout public, y compris aux gens du village qui n’ont pas souvent la chance de voir ce genre de prestations de cirque chez eux. Nous allons donc jouer à «contribution volontaire», mais le risque est grand. En effet, nous avons besoin de fonds pour financer les répétitions, la fabrication des costumes, l’achat des objets lumineux, la location de matériel de sonorisation, les frais de transport du matériel et des chevaux, les assurances, la communication de l’évènement, etc. Nous voulons également payer une captation photo et vidéo de qualité, car notre but est vraiment que cette performance puisse être offerte ailleurs au Québec, autres forêts, parcs urbains, jardins, festivals… Il suffit de quelques arbres pour y installer notre petit univers mythologique!

Nous avons bénéficié d’une subvention de 9 000 $ de l’entente Régionale du Conseil des Arts et des Lettres du Québec et de la CRE de Chaudière-Appalaches. Nous estimons qu’il nous manque 5 000 $ pour mener à bien le projet à la hauteur de notre idéal. Si jamais nous obtenons plus, le montant supplémentaire sera investi dans d’autres représentations. Voici donc notre objectif avec cette campagne Indiegogo.

Nous sommes convaincus que «La Forêt des Hespérides» aura un impacte significatif, d’abord dans la petite communauté de Notre-Dame-du-Rosaire, auprès des spectateurs présents, et dans la vie des artistes impliqués, et qui sait, pour le milieu circassien québécois? C’est une expérience cirque tout à fait unique que nous voulons créer et partager!

 

What we need and what your donations will be used for?

It is an exceptional project, which will be played neither in theatre, nor under a big top, but right in the heart of the nature, far from the city. Consistently, on one hand, we need to spread the information about the project so that the public comes to see it, and on the other hand, there will be no box office. We want these performances to be opened to every public, including the inhabitant of the village who don’t often have the opportunity to see this kind of circus performances so close. We are thus going to play for a public " voluntary contribution ". Indeed, we need fund to finance the rehearsals, the costumes, purchase of the lights, the rental of of sound system, the transportation of the equipment and horses, insurances, etc. We also want to get a quality photo and video shooting, because our purpose is really to offer this performance somewhere else in Quebec, other forests, urban parks, gardens, festivals … Some trees are enough for settling our small mythological universe there!

We are convinced that «La Forêt des Hespérides», will have a significant impact, at first in the small community of Notre-Dame-du-Rosaire, with the present spectators, and in the life of the artists involved, and who knows, for the circassian community from Quebec? It is an completely unique circus experiment, which we want to create and to share!

 

Et en échange, vous aurez quoi?

Tous nos généreux donateurs seront remerciés personnellement sur la page Facebook du projet «La Forêt des Hespérides», et bien sûr chaleureusement invités à venir assister à l’une des prestations !

Pour les détails, consultez notre incroyable gamme de forfaits-cadeaux dans la barre du menu de droite !

Si vous ne pouvez nous soutenir financièrement, vous pouvez tout de même nous aider beaucoup en faisant circuler cette campagne dans vos réseaux, et en venant assister (avec tous vos amis !) à l’une des trois représentations, les 29, 30 ou 31 aout !

Merci infiniment de votre soutien !

 

And in exchange, what will you get ?

All our generous donors will be personally thanked on the Facebook page of the project " La Forêt des Hespérides ", and of course, warmly invited to come to attend to one of the performances!

Please see our fantastical tokens of gratitude located on the sidebar !

Thank you infinitely your support!

If you are unable to financially support our project, please help us spread the word for this campaign.  Share our fundraising campaign with everyone you may know, and please, come see La Forêt des Hespérides on August 29, 30 or 31th , with all your friends !
story_txt:
«La Forêt des Hespérides»
Une performance, alliant art équestre, cirque, danse, création sonore, et environnement illuminé, prenant place dans un coin de forêt des Appalaches. Il s’agit d’une création unique, un moment de magie éphémère qui veut emporter le spectateur hors des sentiers battus, pour une expérience poétique et sensorielle à la fois intime et sans précédent.
 
A performance, allying equestrian art, circus, dance, musical performance, and enlighten environment, taking place in a piece of the Appalachian forest. It is about a unique creation, one moment of short-lived magic, wanting to bring the spectators off the main path, for a poetical and sensorial experiment, as much intimate as unprecedented.
 
Inspiration et description du projet 
Dans la mythologie grecque, les Hespérides  sont les nymphes du Couchant, On en compte traditionnellement trois. Elles résident dans un verger fabuleux, le jardin des Hespérides, situé à la limite occidentale du monde. Héra leur avait donné pour tâche de veiller sur les pommes d'or du jardin des Hespérides qu'elle leur avait confiés, et leur avait pour cela adjoint l'aide du dragon Ladon.
La recherche poétique s’articule autour du mythe de la «Femme-Arbre», créature imaginaire, mythique et symbolique, Fées-Esprit de la Forêt, qu’évoquent les Hespérides. Un spectacle sera sensible, tout en féminité et en grâce, peuplé d’images fortes et symboliques, mais aussi avec une part d’humour. Les personnages vont tantôt se confondre aux arbres, tantôt émerger du paysage sous des traits plus humains, à d’autres moments encore, sembler de purs esprits éthérés.
Les protagonistes de ce moment unique seront Caroline Rochefort, danseuse, acrobate aérienne et voltigeuse équestre; Hélène Leveau, équilibriste et acrobate sur corde molle; Marie-Claude Bouillon, cavalière et dresseuse équestre, accompagnées de trois chevaux de spectacle. La musique sera créée en direct par Maïeul Clairefond à l’aide de différents objets sonores suspendus aux arbres, et d’une basse électrique.
 
Le projet prendra forme dans une forêt mixte qui touche au cœur du village de Notre-Dame-du-Rosaire, dans le Parc des Appalaches. Une installation artistique y prendra vie : accrochage de voiles et de tissus aériens, d’objets sonores et de différents objets lumineux. La performance se déroulera dans cet espace féérique, au coucher du soleil. Le site sera accessible à pied par un chemin partant du village même, grâce à un sentier lumineux. Trois représentations seront offertes, les 29, 30 et 31 aout (reprise le 1er septembre en cas de pluie)
 
Pour les quatre artistes impliqués, ce sera une première de jouer en dehors de la piste, d’un chapiteau ou d’une salle. Nous sommes convaincus que la forêt va nous imprégner, influencer la création, et qui sait, devenir un cinquième personnage!
 
 
Inspiration and description of the project 
In the ancient Greek mythology, Hesperides are the three nymphs of the Sunset. They live in a fabulous orchard, the Garden of Hesperides, located in the western limit of the world. Hera had given them the task of guarding and protecting the golden apples of the Garden of Hesperides, and offered them for this task the assistance of the dragon Ladon.
 
The poetical research is articulated around the myth of the "Tree-Woman", the mythical and symbolic creature, Fairies-spirit of the Forest, whom evoke Hesperides. The performance will be sensitive, elaborated with feminity and grace, filled with strong and symbolic images, but also with a part of humor. The characters will sometimes be metamorphosed in trees, sometimes emerging  from the landscape under more human features, sometimes acting like pure ethereal spirits.
 
The protagonists of this unique moment will be Caroline Rochefort, a dancer, aerialist and equestrian voltigeuse; Hélène Leveau, looserope walker and equilibrist; Marie-Claude Bouillon, equestrian trainer and rider, accompanied with three circus horses. The music will be created live by Maïeul Clairefond, with his electric bass and various sound objects suspended from trees.
 
The project will take place in a forest that touches the heart of the village of Notre-Dame-du-Rosaire, in the Park of Appalachians. An artistic installation will take life there: suspended veils and aerial silk, musical objects and various enlightments. The performance will occur in this magical space, at sunset. The site will be accessible by foot by an enlighten path from the village. Three representations will be offered on August 29, 30 and 31th.
For the four artists involved, it will be a completely new experience. We are convinced that the forest is going to fill us, to influence the creation, and who knows, to become the fifth character!
 
Qui est derrière ce projet?            Who is behind this project?

Marie-Claude Bouillon
Artiste visuelle diplômée de l’université Laval, mais aussi cavalière depuis plus de 20 ans, Marie-Claude s’est formée aux arts équestres au Canada, en France et au Portugal, auprès de maîtres reconnus du cirque et de la Haute École. Son approche des chevaux se fait dans le calme et la douceur, dans une recherche constante de la légèreté des aides et de la compréhension profonde de la nature du cheval. Pour elle, le cirque est un art total, éphémère. Elle s’intéresse à l’esthétique des spectacles, costumes, personnages, recherche et scénographie. Marie-Claude est l’idéatrice du projet.
Visual artist graduate from Laval University, but also dressage rider for more than 20 years, Marie-Claude has been formed in the equestrian arts in Canada, in France and in Portugal, with recognized masters of the circus and Haute École. Her approach of horses is made of calm and sweetness, in a constant search for the lightness and for the deep understanding of the nature of the horse. For her, the circus is a total, living art. She is interested in the aesthetics of the spectacles, costumes, characters, research, writing and scenography. Marie-Claude is the «idéatrice» of the project.
 
Caroline Rochefort
Diplômée du programme de danse contemporaine de l’Université Concordia, elle a complété sa formation de danseuse à New York et en Argentine. Elle a découvert le monde du cirque durant ces études et a décidé de se spécialiser en arts aériens et en voltige équestre. Elle a par la suite suivi différentes formations dans ces deux disciplines au Québec et à l’étranger (France, Irlande). C’est maintenant dans les airs ou à dos de cheval qu’elle exprimer ses passions.
Graduated from the program of contemporary dance of Concordia University, she completed her dancer's formation in New York and in Argentina. She discovered the circus during these studies and decided to specialize in aerial disciplines and in equestrian voltige (bareback and roman riding). She did various training courses in these two disciplines in Quebec and in Europe (France, Ireland). It is now in the airs or on horseback that she express her passions!

story:
Manos Especiales, translated as Special Hands, is a cooperative of Tz´utujil women of Mayan descent, originating in San Juan La Laguna, Guatemala on beautiful Lake Atitlan. Their journey began in 2005 when a Spanish doctor recognized the need for woman to generate income to care for their children with special needs. She worked with them to create products using weaving techniques of the backstrap loom. Each women in the cooperative recognizes the value of historic Tz´utujil Mayan fabric production and contributing to the conservation of the Mayan culture.

A group of five students worked with Manos Especiales on a USF St. Petersburg MBA Study Abroad trip in March. They developed a marketing plan, which includes signage and advertising on the outside of the building, product display, more efficient product pricing, soliciting donations, and creating an online presence. The students completed as many of the plans while there, but there are still areas that the women need help with, including paying off their building loan, shelving and display racks for their products, and creating new inventory to attract additional customers.   

They have a variety of products including scarves, traditional Guatemalan blouses and belts, jewelry, table runners, placemats, purses, wallets, cosmetic bags, laptop cases, book covers, dolls, and water bottle holders. Every sale directly contributes to treatments, therapies, and educational activities that improve the quality of life for their children with special needs.

Manos Especiales is now in their second location. One year ago they moved closer to San Juan La Laguna’s dock, where most tourists arrive when visiting. The cooperative has 15 members, all having one or more children with special needs. The funds raised through this campaign will provide a means for the women to put into action the student's marketing plan. Thank you for your time and consideration in helping Manos Especiales achieve their goals!

story:
What is Ligature?

Ligature is an annual design symposium made up of three parts. 

A gallery exhibition of juried student work.

A lecture series by internationally recognized designers. This year we are hosting:

       Laura Bee working in New York City, New York lovelyascanbee.com

       Josh Lafayette working in Atlanta, GA joshlafayette.com

   3.Hands-on workshops and portfolio reviews by the guest designers.

The best part about Ligature is that it is completely student-run, from the concept to the gallery design. Partially funded by Student Government, this event has become a gathering for alumni, designers from the community, and world-renowned artists who visit to share their insight in a rapidly changing industry.

 

Help us celebrate 26 Years!

Ligature has been an integral part of UF's graphic design program as well as the Gainesville design community for the past 26 years–it’s an opportunity to meet and work alongside the designers that inspire us on a daily basis. With budget cuts increasing each year Ligature becomes more difficult to put together. Any money raised would help us complete the gallery, produce materials for the event, and supplement payment for the designers.

 

Budget Breakdown for Ligature 26

The funding we have received thus far has covered flights and part of the guests honorariums. However, we still need your help for the following: 

Guest Honorariums: $1,000

Guest Expenses (hotel + gas + food): $1,000

 

Lets make this happen!

If the available perks aren't appealing enough, let us know and we will personally try and figure something out for you!

If you have any questions at all, send email us at ligature26@gmail.com.

 

Ligature 26 will be the weekend of February 25th, 2016 at University of Florida's Fine Arts Building C.

See you there!

story:
About uFunbrush

 Designed by parents to help make the experience of brushing their kids' teeth easy. If you brush your teeth for the recommended 2 minutes with a regular toothbrush, every surface gets brushed for just a few seconds.

Why uFunbrush

One of the biggest issues for parents…is getting their kids to brush their teeth!. When kids finally do brush, it may not be effective and certainly not fun. uFunbrush was developed to put the FUN into brushing teeth. uFunbrush is the Fun solution for kids! It takes away the headache of a daily “chore” and makes brushing FUN! And guess what…parents like it too!

The Fun Solution!

uFunbrush brushes all your children's teeth at once for a complete clean in just ten seconds. Our uFunbrush sonic technology creates a unique cleaning action that forces fluid between teeth and along the gums to dislodge plaque, in a gentle yet effective cleaning for kids. In general, the advantage of a sonic tooth-brush is that it cleans teeth beyond just conventional tooth scrubbing, it also creates a second cleaning action that helps to disrupt dental plaque beyond where the tips of the bristles actually touch.

uFunbrush Mouthpiece

The uFunbrush Mouthpiece is soft enough to provide a gentle clean but strong enough to clean your teeth effectively. It can be cleaned by normal rinsing, as with regular toothbrushes.

Replacement

As with regular toothbrushes and electric toothbrush heads, the uFunbrush mouthpiece should be replaced every 3-6 months. A single mouthpiece will cost US$7.

BRUSHING THAT'S EASIER

uFunbrush is a revolutionary U-shaped sonic toothbrush that cleans all  teeth at one time. All your kids need to do is simply bite down, press a single button, have fun for 10 seconds, and have perfectly clean teeth!

Bass-Method

Recommended by Dentists, the Importance of these methods is as follows

  1. Effective in cleaning cervical 1/3 & beneath gingival margins
  2. Suitable for everyone
  3. Periodontal maintenance
  4. Cleanses the space between tooth and gums

More Free Time

Using uFunbrush puts the Fun back into brushing and saves time. In 10 seconds, your Kids complete what was once a chore and now have an effective way to clean their teeth which keeps Mom and Dad happy…with less time arguing over having their kids brush their teeth!

BRUSHING THAT'S SAFE

Made with heat-resistant, non-toxic, non-sticky, odorless, food grade liquid silicon. uFunbrush is Nitrosamine free and complies with FDA standards.

BRUSHING THAT'S BETTER    

uFunbrush offers a perfect clean without the struggle. Most young children do not have the manual dexterity to brush properly, leaving behind germs and bacteria that can cause bad breath, tooth decay and gingivitis.

BRUSHING THAT'S FUN

Get the kids excited about oral hygiene and make teeth brushing a fun experience! uFunbrush comes with a variety of fun stickers for the front of the base.

 

It's time for kids to have FUN brushing their teeth!

  • FILL: Fill the uFunbrush head with your child's favorite toothpaste.
  • PRESS: Put the uFunbrush head into their mouth and hit the power button. 
  • CLEAN: uFunbrush will clean their teeth and automatically turn off in TEN seconds! 
  • RINSE: Thoroughly rinse the uFunbrush head after every use.

Avoid messy mornings with the uFunbrush! The special uFunbrush head design keeps the toothpaste inside the mouth! Save valuable time in the morning with the 10 second automatic timer!

The food grade liquid silicone cleans up fast and easy. uFunbrush is Waterproof - IPX6

uFunbrush Technology 

U-sonic = U shape toothbrush head + sonic cleaning

 The uFunbrush's patented design includes:

uFunbrush Head 
Sonic Base

uFunbrush Head

Made from high quality food grade liquid silicone with six sides of soft bristles. The bristles include top, bottom, front, back, left, and right. The soft bristles cover all the children’s teeth (top, bottom, front, back, left and right).

The sonic vibrations make the toothpaste and water become an infinitude of small particles which could go through the space of teeth. It will clean all teeth at the same time.


Sonic Base

Creates sonic vibrations and transfers them to the uFunbrush head. The 10,000 rpm sonic motor is specialized for kids electric toothbrush. The gentle sonic pulsations, make it a safe, effective and fun way to brush their teeth.

10 Second Timer

uFunbrush can clean children teeth in just 10 seconds, because of the patented design of 6 side bristles in the U channel + sonic clean. 

The six side bristles will cover and clean all of your teeth at the same time. In only 10 seconds, every tooth surface is cleaned longer compared with common toothbrushes, with only one sided bristles.

The uFunbrush will last

600 Sessions on just ONE AAA battery!

If you use uFunbrush twice a day it will last up to 10 months!

What about replacements? 

All toothbrushes should be replaced every 6 months, including conventional, electric and the uFunbrush.

To replace the uFunbrush head, just rotate the uFunbrush head 90 degrees with the Sonic base, then you can pull it off. 

Simply put the new uFunbrush head into the base, and rotate it flush with the sonic base. 

Over the past three years our team has analyzed many jaws from different children & adults (male & female) to determine the best dimensions for our uFunbrush sizes.


Keeping it simple, we have selected four popular colors for both girls and boys for this first production run.


It works great for adults too!

We also offer an adult version for those busy bees! Save time in the mornings with the fast acting uFunbrush. With uFunbrush, you can enjoy brushing your teeth with your kids or use by yourself.  

 

 

Our Team consists of two Fathers and a Mom.

Simon is the creator. He is a manufacturer and top project engineer with a Masters of Science in Engineering. He is the Father of a boy and a girl. Simon Loves his children and has the same problem as every parent when it comes time to ask their kids to brush their teeth. He developed the idea for uFunbrush and has been working on it day and night for years. With his background in brainstorming ideas and bringing them to life, he knew what needed to be done to bring his concept to reality. The reality is uFunbrush is a great product and will bring the Fun factor back Oral Hygiene!

Robert is the Dentist and the Father of two girls. A great consultant in the group. Robert is responsible for overseeing the testing requirements and quality control methods that will assure all backers of a great product that has thoroughly met our very stringent requirements. Robert will inspect, approve and make sure every uFunbrush is 100% what our backers expect it to be! 

Sarah, is the Mother of two young children, a boy and girl. She brings the Mom factor to our team and is a critical factor in working with our test group and kids, in order to make sure uFunbrush is the best product it can possibly be.

uFunbrush on Mashable
uFunbrush on Bouncy
uFunbrush on Electricteeth

Risks & Challenges

The uFunbrush is a brand new product that we are bringing to the global community of crowdfunding. This requires a high level of execution and precision. Like any new product coming to market there will be challenges but our team is prepared and experienced to bring a top quality product to our first supporters! We do not expect any delays in production because we have already completed the manufacturing process. With that being said, we will maintain a high level of communication with our backers every step of the way during and after our campaign through delivery and on.

Our team has been working on uFunbrush for six years. The prototypes are functioning, a patent has been granted, and the product is DFM ready. Our manufacturing partner has over 20 years experience producing sonic toothbrushes. With your support, we can finance the first production and bring this FUN new product to the global market!
story_txt:
About uFunbrush
 Designed by parents to help make the experience of brushing their kids' teeth easy. If you brush your teeth for the recommended 2 minutes with a regular toothbrush, every surface gets brushed for just a few seconds.


Why uFunbrush
One of the biggest issues for parents…is getting their kids to brush their teeth!. When kids finally do brush, it may not be effective and certainly not fun. uFunbrush was developed to put the FUN into brushing teeth. uFunbrush is the Fun solution for kids! It takes away the headache of a daily “chore” and makes brushing FUN! And guess what…parents like it too!

The Fun Solution!
uFunbrush brushes all your children's teeth at once for a complete clean in just ten seconds. Our uFunbrush sonic technology creates a unique cleaning action that forces fluid between teeth and along the gums to dislodge plaque, in a gentle yet effective cleaning for kids. In general, the advantage of a sonic tooth-brush is that it cleans teeth beyond just conventional tooth scrubbing, it also creates a second cleaning action that helps to disrupt dental plaque beyond where the tips of the bristles actually touch.
uFunbrush Mouthpiece
The uFunbrush Mouthpiece is soft enough to provide a gentle clean but strong enough to clean your teeth effectively. It can be cleaned by normal rinsing, as with regular toothbrushes.
Replacement
As with regular toothbrushes and electric toothbrush heads, the uFunbrush mouthpiece should be replaced every 3-6 months. A single mouthpiece will cost US$7.
BRUSHING THAT'S EASIER
uFunbrush is a revolutionary U-shaped sonic toothbrush that cleans all  teeth at one time. All your kids need to do is simply bite down, press a single button, have fun for 10 seconds, and have perfectly clean teeth!
Bass-Method
Recommended by Dentists, the Importance of these methods is as follows

Effective in cleaning cervical 1/3 & beneath gingival margins
Suitable for everyone
Periodontal maintenance
Cleanses the space between tooth and gums

More Free Time
Using uFunbrush puts the Fun back into brushing and saves time. In 10 seconds, your Kids complete what was once a chore and now have an effective way to clean their teeth which keeps Mom and Dad happy…with less time arguing over having their kids brush their teeth!

BRUSHING THAT'S SAFE
Made with heat-resistant, non-toxic, non-sticky, odorless, food grade liquid silicon. uFunbrush is Nitrosamine free and complies with FDA standards.

BRUSHING THAT'S BETTER    
uFunbrush offers a perfect clean without the struggle. Most young children do not have the manual dexterity to brush properly, leaving behind germs and bacteria that can cause bad breath, tooth decay and gingivitis.

story:
Short Summary

A couple years ago, I had a little conversation with my daughter.

Her: Dad, give me two things to draw, together.
Me: Uhm... doctor Tyrannosaurus.
Her: I drew that already.  Something else.
Me: Uhm... princess ninja.
Her: DAD! I said two things that are DIFFERENT! Princesses are ALREADY ninjas!

That was a very educational conversation for me.  Both my girls enjoy writing little stories, but I suddenly had a great mental image of a classical fantasy royal family, with one princess being... a little different from the usual.

The story has been written for quite some time, but I've not been able to find a reliable, affordable illustrator (affordable for someone without any money, at least).  I occasionally print out copies without any artwork at all, and let my daughters illustrate them, but they keep asking me when they can see a REAL copy.

Hopefully, with your help, they can.


An Excerpt From The Story

In a faraway kingdom that you’ve probably never heard of
A young princess was born on a cloudy spring day.

She had three older sisters, all princesses,
(because that’s what happens when
 your mom is the Queen, you know),
But she was not like them.
Her sisters were all born Princesses...
But she was born a Ninja.

The King and the Queen were quite distraught.
“A ninja for a daughter!” they moaned. “The shame!”
They filled her life with Princessly things,
like ball gowns and ponies and tea parties and games,
but it was no use.

Her sisters ate teacakes and
Princess Ninja ate octopus.

Her sisters drank honey tea and
Princess Ninja drank hot sauce.

For dessert, her sisters had ice cream sundaes.
And so did Princess Ninja...
because even ninjas like ice cream.

In their desperation, the King and Queen turned to Sir Zephyr, 
the Royal Retainer, wise in the ways of honour and nobility.

“Help us, most honourable Sir,” they pleaded,
“Princess Ninja is hardly a Princess at all!”

As the months went by, the King and Queen grew impatient.
“Well?” they asked one day. “Does she still think she’s a Ninja?”
“Of course,” said Sir Zephyr. “She was born a Ninja.”

“But she’s a Princess!” they insisted.
“Of course,” said Sir Zephyr. “She was born a Princess.”

- - - - -

Princess Ninja sets out on a quest to find someone who truly understands her: a pet. What sort of pet would a Princess Ninja choose? Why, nothing short of a dragon.
On her journey, she discovers that sometimes even she can have misconceptions, and sometimes the most important thing you can find is a friend.

What We Need & What You Get

I've gotten quotes from several online and local publishers, as well as sampled finding an illustrator on Elance. Of the roughly 24 submissions I received on Elance, I found 7 or 8 that were skilled and highly-rated. I am budgeting approximately $1000 for publishing and $850 for illustrations, and $150 for incidentals (shipping, displays, advertising, etc).

I already have verbal agreements with the libraries in the Okanagan, as well as the library in Prince George, to carry the book, as they love to support local authors.  Many other local bookstores sell local authors' self-published books, and Books & Co. has agreed to sell Princess Ninja when I can supply them with copies. 

And, of course, there are copies for all of my supportive friends and family!


    Other Ways You Can Help

    • Spam my link
    • Tell your friends
    • Support your local authors!

story:
About me: My name is Jessica Caldas and I am an Atlanta based visual artist and social justice advocate. My work revolves around sharing people’s stories and connecting those stories to the social issues that impact them, including domestic violence, homelessness, sexual assault and more.  I believe viewing larger social and political issues through a personal lens allows various audiences to be drawn in, to accept that the issues impact everyone, and to abandon the notion of “other”.  I am driven by a philosophy that understanding comes through either direct experience or through the sharing of personal narratives  and that by focusing on the extremely personal we can understand and experience something more universal.

About the residency: I was selected in a competitive process to travel to Newcastle, Australia in November to participate in an artist's residency called the Backyard Bus. During this residency I will grow my project, We are all statistics, using community collaboration and art to create awareness, further education, and engage the public with various social issues as they affect their local community.  This is a rare opportunity for me to engage with a new community and to grow my practice in a significant way.  In order to take complete advantage of this opportunity I need your help to reach the full sum I am asking for.

What I'm asking for and what I'm giving you:

I am asking for a total of $5000. Any amount you can give to reach that goal will help me considerably-every little bit helps!  As a full time artist, it's important that I reach the full sum to cover the complete cost of this residency and the work I will do there. This sum will cover airfare, travel expenses, daily living in Australia, materials for the project and work I do in Australia, materials for what I'm giving to you in return for your generosity, and expenses that occur while I'm away from home.

In return for your contribution, I am offering a lot, and the majority of what I'm giving you are original artworks, often tailored to what you specifically want. Every dollar will help me reach my goal, and so every dollar you give will be rewarded.

(For an abbreviated list of perks, see the side bar to the right, all perks are estimated to be delivered between December 2014 and February 2015)

  • $1 or more= shout out on social media: everyone who contributes to this campaign (unless otherwise specified) will receive a shout out from me on my various social media outlets.  I'm serious when I say every dollar counts.

An image of my installation in Harrisonburg, Virginia

  • $10 or more=photographic postcard of the work done in Australia: everyone who contributes $10 or more will receive a postcard with an image of my work with a handwritten note from me.
(Delivery of all of the following perks will include social media shout outs as well as a postcard.)
  • $25=When in Oz... Zine:  For $25, you will receive a hand bound copy of a Zine based on my sketchbook and journal from my time in Australia

Educate Yourself Series, Print one: Power and Control
Educate Yourself Series, Print two: Cycle of Violence
Educate Yourself Series, Print three: Equality

Educate Yourself: Violence in Relationships Series: This three print series was inspired by three wheels used to educate people about domestic violence; the power and control wheel, the cycle of violence wheel, and the equality wheel. Each print is a hand pulled, two color, 11x14 inch relief print. 

  • $35=Choice of one print from Educate Yourself: Violence in Relationships series
  • $60=Choice of two prints from Educate Yourself: Violence in Relationships series
  • $75=The entire Educate Yourself: Violence in Relationships series
  
  • $150=Personalized Definitions of Behavior and Identity Box: These pieces are a part of my Out of Context body of work and are hand made boxes which house the definitions of words in two ways: Urban Dictionary printouts and a Webster's dictionary cutouts inside a glass vial.  For $150 you'll get a personalized box with any word of your choosing. I highly recommend browsing the site and using your own name for the box, as an example, you can check out what definitions have been entered for my name, Jessica.
"This is romance...?" Print (The final print may look slightly different, as this is a mock up of a variable edition)

"This is a man...?" Print (The final print may look slightly different, as this is a mock up of a variable edition)

  • $300=Choice of one of the following prints:This is romance...? or This is a man...? :  These prints are new additions to the series This is a...?. They are limited edition, four layer, 24x40 inch, hand pulled screen prints.  For $300 you'll get your choice of the series.

A portrait of two young girls, completed for their parents.
  • $500=Commissioned Portrait: I call the portraits I make "Visual Narratives" because I'm invested in telling a story, however short or small, about the subject of the portrait.  For $500, I'll create a portrait for you, of whoever you like (you, your dog, your children, or even your favorite celebrity, etc).  The size of the portrait will range between 24 to 36 inches in width and 20 to 40 inches in height.  Pictured above, you can see a few examples of past portraits I've been commissioned to complete.  This process will require extra communication with me, and possibly even a meeting or several to complete.

  

  • $800=Personalized Hello, my name is... print series:  The first edition of this series was a part of my body of work, Out of Context, and was made about my own various identifiers.  For $800 I'll create a 32 print series of name tags for you, relating to your own experience with identity. Each print in the series is a hand pulled,  6x8 inch, mono type, screen, and relief based print with hand drawn elements. This perk will require additional communication with me to complete."Barriers to consent" An example of past prints I have made based on experiences with survivors.
  • $1000=Work created from survivor stories and interactions during residency: during my time in Australia I'll be interviewing various survivors and advocates about their experiences and based on these interviews I will create unique mono prints.  The sizes of these prints will vary and you will be able to choose from the entire series in the order of when you contributed.

What else should you know about me:

I am an emerging artist which means I'm in the beginning stages of my career.  Still, at this rather early stage I have already gone full time in my practice and work hard to make a living creating.  Recently I was awarded the City of Atlanta's Emerging Artist Award for Visual Arts and was a finalist for the Forward Arts Foundation's Emerging Artist Award.

My work is shown locally and nationally and has been covered in various publications including ArtsAtl, Burnaway, the Creative Loafing, Atlanta Magazine, CommonCreativATL, and the Examiner. On September 1st, my work will be featured in "Artists to look out for", a publication released by the Starry Night Retreat.

"This is not who I am, I'm just protecting what I love" 

What is an artist's residency?

Artist residencies are generally opportunities for artists to spend time away from the pressures of daily living in order to focus on their art.

The Backyard Bus is hosted by Emerald Violin and is a project based residency.  The Backyard Bus is located in Newcastle, Australia and seeks artists of any discipline, who are committed to creating work with a strong alignment to health and well-being, social justice and/or community development values.  They provide free accommodation and project support during the residency but do not cover food costs, materials costs, or travel expenses.


Me working at The Hambidge Arts Center

What will I do during my time with The Backyard Bus?

During my time in Newcastle I will meet with several organizations I have contacted to learn more first hand about the work they do.  Each of the organizations I meet with will be invited to share data they have collected about their work with me, so that I can use it for installations in public spaces around the city.  These installations are a continuation of my project, We are all statistics.  Additionally, I hope to schedule community conversations and materials with the help of the partner organizations to help increase education and awareness about the issues and the work they do.

In addition to the public art installations, I will invite the organizations to connect me with willing advocates and survivors that are interested in being interviewed. Based on those interviews I will create new prints, and each interviewee will receive a print as thanks for their time and generosity.  For the last three years it has been a huge part of my practice to create images that tell general stories of those affected by various social issues and I am focusing this practice now into individual stories.

Finally, I will continue research for my ongoing body of work Out of Context.  This body of work explores the ways we use language in negative and positive contexts in connection to issues of identity. I am concerned how our behaviors are affected by the use of language, whether used positively or negatively, how we identify with language, how we reclaim it, how we censor it, and what this means for us as individuals and as a community.  I hope to continue this research with regards to the specific community in Newcastle and the languages of Australia particularly.

Have I ever done this kind of public, community engaged work?

Yes! I have done several public art projects through programs like the City of Atlanta's public art project, ELEVATE, the Beltline's Public Art project, and through other residencies.  All of my public art projects have relied on communication and collaboration with local organizations and sought to create awareness about various issues and the organizations that work on those issues in the community.


A wheat paste installation I completed for Elevate 2012

Have I ever done this kind of intensive residency before?

Yes! I have been selected for various competitive residencies and fellowships in the past, both in and outside of my home base, Atlanta.  All have been incredibly important, and valuable experiences for me where I have grown as an individual and an artist and allowed me to continue to be competitive in my career.  These residencies and fellowships include The Atlanta Printmakers Studio's Emerging Artist Residency, MINT Gallery's Leap Year Residency, WonderRoot's Walthall Fellowship, The Hambidge Center, The Old Furnace Arts Residency, and The Blue Mountain Center.

What is the project, We are all statistics about?

We are all statistics is an ongoing project I began this year.  I wanted to toy with the kind of information and data that the issues I am interested in generate.  In a reversal from examining the larger social impact on an individual and their story, I am interested in how demographic information expresses not only the individual but the group.  For this project I take data concerning a specific issue and community and work to translate that information in a visual way and public way, allowing someone to see the impact the issue has on their community. 

 

The most recent installation of this project occurred in Harrisonburg, Virginia where I collaborated with a local rape prevention and sexual assault awareness organization.  They had helped 152 child victims of abuse and from the data regarding those children I drew 152 hopscotch courts in the downtown area of the town.  During the time I was installing this work, I was able to speak with community members about the project, raise awareness about the issue and the organization's work.  You can read more about that work here.

  

In Atlanta, Georgia I was able to create another installation of this project.  The Atlanta installation represented the more then 2000 victims of intimate partner violence in the city who had filed for temporary protective orders in 2013.  Through a wallpaper pattern I was able to relate the specific demographics of each person and family affected by domestic violence.

In Australia I will expand the installations further and invite communities to join me in the process.

What I'm asking for and what I'm giving you:
 I am asking for a total of $5000. Any amount you can give to reach that goal will help me considerably-every little bit helps!  As a full time artist, it's important that I reach the full sum to cover the complete cost of this residency and the work I will do there. This sum will cover airfare, travel expenses, daily living in Australia, materials for the project and work I do in Australia, materials for what I'm giving to you in return for your generosity, and expenses that occur while I'm away from home.
In return for your contribution, I am offering a lot, and the majority of what I'm giving you are original artworks, often tailored to what you specifically want. Every dollar will help me reach my goal, and so every dollar you give will be rewarded.
(For an abbreviated list of perks, see the side bar to the right, all perks are estimated to be delivered between December 2014 and February 2015) $1 or more= shout out on social media: everyone who contributes to this campaign (unless otherwise specified) will receive a shout out from me on my various social media outlets.  I'm serious when I say every dollar counts.

An image of my installation in Harrisonburg, Virginia


$10 or more=photographic postcard of the work done in Australia: everyone who contributes $10 or more will receive a postcard with an image of my work with a handwritten note from me.
(Delivery of all of the following perks will include social media shout outs as well as a postcard.)

$25=When in Oz... Zine:  For $25, you will receive a hand bound copy of a Zine based on my sketchbook and journal from my time in Australia


Educate Yourself Series, Print one: Power and Control


Educate Yourself Series, Print two: Cycle of Violence


Educate Yourself Series, Print three: Equality

Educate Yourself: Violence in Relationships Series: This three print series was inspired by three wheels used to educate people about domestic violence; the power and control wheel, the cycle of violence wheel, and the equality wheel. Each print is a hand pulled, two color, 11x14 inch relief print. 


$35=Choice of one print from Educate Yourself: Violence in Relationships series


$60=Choice of two prints from Educate Yourself: Violence in Relationships series


$75=The entire Educate Yourself: Violence in Relationships series

  
$150=Personalized Definitions of Behavior and Identity Box: These pieces are a part of my Out of Context body of work and are hand made boxes which house the definitions of words in two ways: Urban Dictionary printouts and a Webster's dictionary cutouts inside a glass vial.  For $150 you'll get a personalized box with any word of your choosing. I highly recommend browsing the site and using your own name for the box, as an example, you can check out what definitions have been entered for my name, Jessica.



"This is romance...?" Print (The final print may look slightly different, as this is a mock up of a variable edition)

"This is a man...?" Print (The final print may look slightly different, as this is a mock up of a variable edition)



$300=Choice of one of the following prints:This is romance...? or This is a man...? :  These prints are new additions to the series This is a...?. They are limited edition, four layer, 24x40 inch, hand pulled screen prints.  For $300 you'll get your choice of the series.

A portrait of two young girls, completed for their parents.

$500=Commissioned Portrait: I call the portraits I make "Visual Narratives" because I'm invested in telling a story, however short or small, about the subject of the portrait.  For $500, I'll create a portrait for you, of whoever you like (you, your dog, your children, or even your favorite celebrity, etc).  The size of the portrait will range between 24 to 36 inches in width and 20 to 40 inches in height.  Pictured above, you can see a few examples of past portraits I've been commissioned to complete.  This process will require extra communication with me, and possibly even a meeting or several to complete.



  


$800=Personalized Hello, my name is... print series:  The first edition of this series was a part of my body of work, Out of Context, and was made about my own various identifiers.  For $800 I'll create a 32 print series of name tags for you, relating to your own experience with identity. Each print in the series is a hand pulled,  6x8 inch, mono type, screen, and relief based print with hand drawn elements. This perk will require additional communication with me to complete."Barriers to consent" An example of past prints I have made based on experiences with survivors.

$1000=Work created from survivor stories and interactions during residency: during my time in Australia I'll be interviewing various survivors and advocates about their experiences and based on these interviews I will create unique mono prints.  The sizes of these prints will vary and you will be able to choose from the entire series in the order of when you contributed.


What else should you know about me:
I am an emerging artist which means I'm in the beginning stages of my career.  Still, at this rather early stage I have already gone full time in my practice and work hard to make a living creating.  Recently I was awarded the City of Atlanta's Emerging Artist Award for Visual Arts and was a finalist for the Forward Arts Foundation's Emerging Artist Award.

My work is shown locally and nationally and has been covered in various publications including ArtsAtl, Burnaway, the Creative Loafing, Atlanta Magazine, CommonCreativATL, and the Examiner. On September 1st, my work will be featured in "Artists to look out for", a publication released by the Starry Night Retreat.



"This is not who I am, I'm just protecting what I love" 

What is an artist's residency?
Artist residencies are generally opportunities for artists to spend time away from the pressures of daily living in order to focus on their art.

The Backyard Bus is hosted by Emerald Violin and is a project based residency.  The Backyard Bus is located in Newcastle, Australia and seeks artists of any discipline, who are committed to creating work with a strong alignment to health and well-being, social justice and/or community development values.  They provide free accommodation and project support during the residency but do not cover food costs, materials costs, or travel expenses.



Me working at The Hambidge Arts Center
What will I do during my time with The Backyard Bus?

During my time in Newcastle I will meet with several organizations I have contacted to learn more first hand about the work they do.  Each of the organizations I meet with will be invited to share data they have collected about their work with me, so that I can use it for installations in public spaces around the city.  These installations are a continuation of my project, We are all statistics.  Additionally, I hope to schedule community conversations and materials with the help of the partner organizations to help increase education and awareness about the issues and the work they do.

In addition to the public art installations, I will invite the organizations to connect me with willing advocates and survivors that are interested in being interviewed. Based on those interviews I will create new prints, and each interviewee will receive a print as thanks for their time and generosity.  For the last three years it has been a huge part of my practice to create images that tell general stories of those affected by various social issues and I am focusing this practice now into individual stories.

Finally, I will continue research for my ongoing body of work Out of Context.  This body of work explores the ways we use language in negative and positive contexts in connection to issues of identity. I am concerned how our behaviors are affected by the use of language, whether used positively or negatively, how we identify with language, how we reclaim it, how we censor it, and what this means for us as individuals and as a community.  I hope to continue this research with regards to the specific community in Newcastle and the languages of Australia particularly.

Have I ever done this kind of public, community engaged work?

Yes! I have done several public art projects through programs like the City of Atlanta's public art project, ELEVATE, the Beltline's Public Art project, and through other residencies.  All of my public art projects have relied on communication and collaboration with local organizations and sought to create awareness about various issues and the organizations that work on those issues in the community.



A wheat paste installation I completed for Elevate 2012

Have I ever done this kind of intensive residency before?


Yes! I have been selected for various competitive residencies and fellowships in the past, both in and outside of my home base, Atlanta.  All have been incredibly important, and valuable experiences for me where I have grown as an individual and an artist and allowed me to continue to be competitive in my career.  These residencies and fellowships include The Atlanta Printmakers Studio's Emerging Artist Residency, MINT Gallery's Leap Year Residency, WonderRoot's Walthall Fellowship, The Hambidge Center, The Old Furnace Arts Residency, and The Blue Mountain Center.


What is the project, We are all statistics about?

We are all statistics is an ongoing project I began this year.  I wanted to toy with the kind of information and data that the issues I am interested in generate.  In a reversal from examining the larger social impact on an individual and their story, I am interested in how demographic information expresses not only the individual but the group.  For this project I take data concerning a specific issue and community and work to translate that information in a visual way and public way, allowing someone to see the impact the issue has on their community. 
 
The most recent installation of this project occurred in Harrisonburg, Virginia where I collaborated with a local rape prevention and sexual assault awareness organization.  They had helped 152 child victims of abuse and from the data regarding those children I drew 152 hopscotch courts in the downtown area of the town.  During the time I was installing this work, I was able to speak with community members about the project, raise awareness about the issue and the organization's work.  You can read more about that work here.
  
In Atlanta, Georgia I was able to create another installation of this project.  The Atlanta installation represented the more then 2000 victims of intimate partner violence in the city who had filed for temporary protective orders in 2013.  Through a wallpaper pattern I was able to relate the specific demographics of each person and family affected by domestic violence.
In Australia I will expand the installations further and invite communities to join me in the process.

story:
~A RESIDENCY AND A DREAM~

Hi everyone! My name is Hawa and I'm a photographer and writer living in the great town of Oakland. I grew up in Virginia under in a household with beautiful Afghani mother and handsome Afghani, amateur photographer of a dad. After some tragic life stuff, I grew distant from 'the arts' in an attempt to 'get real.' Over the past few years though, I’m finding that getting real means staying true to my roots in photography and offering my vision of the world as a young Middle Eastern woman grappling with post 9-11 identity issues.

So what's up now? I've been offered a month long residency for the month of July 2014 at an upcoming warehouse and gallery space, B4BEL4ND, in Oakland's Chinatown. With Oakland coming up on a 'renaissance,' I want to bring contemporary Middle Eastern art practice and experience into the conversation- I believe a much needed one. 

~*~*~ SUBMIT YOUR WORK HERE FOR INCLUSION IN FINAL GALLERY SHOW JULY 31st, OUR DIGITAL PLATFORM IS LIVE ~*~*~

Residency: What I hope to explore for the month of July is where concept meets fashion and adornment via themes of contemporary Middle Eastern modes of production, art practice, and thinking. It's a complex healing of my personal grip on identity--- aaand it's also about community building and presenting a vision of the world in contrast to the commodified ones that exist (arabic text on t-shirts, veil hype, etc.)


  • Self-portrait series - a very personal exploration in studio on identity and relationship to culture/family/religion

  • Open studio hours - q&a, just hang, skype, social media chat wit u about my current feels

  • International collaboration - I’m bringing in collabs from the Middle East to the Netherlands, Canada to Utah, New York to LA, growing over the residency and open to submission.

  • Web platform for submissions - where the international collabs will live forever, from original art and stories to diary entries and selfies.

  • July 10: Opening Reception- presentation of 1 original piece and introduction to local/international collaborators

  • July 31: Soft Closing- final pieces presented along with an educational marketplace

  • August 2: MAS#ALLAH

MAS#ALLAH is an Arabic phrase of praise, gratitude, and protection. Ending the residency on this note, I’d like the space to be turned into a party celebrating the work and collaboration on an international level with music (DJ/music list will be updated as booked!) digital projections, and tea.

What We Need & What You Get

This budget is MINIMAL considering production costs and Indiegogo's cut so I'm praying for some angel investors~~

  • $1,500 of my budget will be going to production: printing (digital graphics & photography), framing, key pieces of equipment (wireless shutter trigger for self-portraits, lighting), promotional material for events

  • $1,000 will be paying the artists contributing pieces to the show, production crew and documentation of MAS#ALLAH- It’s VITAL for me to be able to pay my contributors and collaborators for their work in not only bringing my vision alive, but creating a platform for much needed dialogue around contemporary Middle Eastern experience.

  • Artists will be contributing custom work as gifts for your generosity, and I will be contributing small prints, custom photoshoots, hand written letters, guest list to MAS#ALLAH, original short fiction work inspired by you, pieces of wardrobe from my shoots, larger prints / pick of the final show / Co-curator title for big spenders. 

  • IF I don’t reach my goal- priority funding goes to making sure I have work up for the final show (printing/production costs) and my eternal gratitude for my collaborators <3 

IMPACT

My passion for this project, and the momentum I want to build far beyond this residency, is too big for words or a thousand words in one picture or anything.

Personal: Personally, this is a tremendous healing process that I’m set to discover and work through no matter what- both identity wise and healing loss. Having this residency funded in part will allow me to focus entirely on that journey and feel the support and affirmation that my story and the story of my community is an important one. It's also helping me gain confidence to pursue photography in a more conceptual way, which is what I feel most passionate about.

Community: I’m hoping to create dialogue with local community via open hours and the various public facing launches (opening, closing, MAS#ALLAH)

Global: Hopefully this project brings visibility to the work of others I’ve asked to be part of this project and, collectively, our final project serving as an artifact of our modern experience.

STATS- Browntourage as an online publication has operated for 3 years turning out original content since day 1. Our following and reach is in the tens of thousands, and we've covered things such as the SF International Film Festival, presented at the 2013 Allied Media Conference and 2014 Islamophobia Conference, and were voted Best Style site in the bay! On the agency side of things, we've collaborated with other magazines such as Interrupt, have had clients like Princeton’s Center for African American Studies, consulted on everything from diversity to branding, digital media engagement and the list goes on.

KONVERSATION- Where you can find most of my photography and storytelling work is on a custom, interactive digital platform developed by Browntourage.

Work appeared in: San Francisco Magazine, BelleSF (NSFW), The Fader, SF Bay Guardian ~~


RISKS

I’ve never asked for anything like this before, and when I was offered this residency, it made sense to go to my community, your community, and anyone who resonates with the work to get support for this project!! It's not just about me, it's about YOU and how might see the world a little differently. 

NO MONEY BUT YOU’RE DOWN FOR THE CAUSE?

I could absolutely use your help with contacts you think I should get in touch with, investors, potential contributors, or people in the bay area wanting to learn more by visiting the space and helping with installation

  • Share this project on social media, email lists, secret facebook groups, with your friend who might be struggling to live their truth, or as a modern digital gift for my birthday (as of this launch)!

  • PRESS! If you have contacts or want to get this project some coverage, that would be stellar.

  • Email me at veryfutureconcepts (at) gmail (dot) com for any/all inquiries, tips, motivational youtube videos, or donations of resource~

My gratitude for you even getting this far is beyond, so much appreciation for any help resource wise you're able to provide.

<3 <3 <3 <3 <3 <3 <3 <3 <3 <3 <3 <3 <3 <3 <3 <3 <3 <3 <3 <3 <3 <3 <3 <3 

PRIZES:

$85- All the perks PLUS this #rare Spice Girls RECORD

$21-22 CUSTOM LIMITED EDITION POSTERS (5 of each)
