GOLV, VATTEN och AVLOPP (bland annat så de som arbetar i lokstallet ska kunna gå på toa!) känns som tredje prioritet. Fortfarande på rätt akut nivå för att överhuvud taget kunna använda lokstallet och hålla öppet. Prel kostnad:  660 000 kr.
VARMBONAD KURSLOKAL plus PENTRY där lera och kursdeltagare inte fryser hamnar bortåt nummer fyra. Prel kostnad: 380 000 kr.
ENTRESOLPLAN med lagringsutrymme och passage upp till övre tornrummet. Prel kostnad: 400 000 kr.
BJÄLKLAG i tornrummets nya golv. Prel kostnad: 38 000 kr.
SKYLTNING och INFORMATION utförd av Jamtli mm. Prel kostnad: 19 500 kr.
KAFFEMASKIN och MINIKAFÉ i lokstallets entré skulle jag önska mig redan till nästa sommar - men det kan inte prioriteras så högt... tak och golv måste komma före kafferep. Men vänta bara, det kommer det också.  Ej kostnadssatt.
STENSÄTTNING och iläggning av två järnvägsspårsnuttar för att visa historiens vingslag framför entréportarna. Det kan bara hända om jag får ruskigt mycket pengar över eller om någon skulle få lust att skänka några ton med smågatsten och räls. Man vet ju aldrig! Ej kostnadssatt.
 

'Det är bråttom nu, om det inte ska gå alltför illa med byggnaden!'  Björn Olofsson, Jamtli
 
PERK betyder lockbete och tackgåva i ett ord 

Ett crowdfundingprojekt går ut på att de som backar upp insamlingen ekonomiskt också får någon sorts så kallad 'PERK' - en tackpresent. För att undvika att pengarna jag samlar in blir skattepliktiga får dessa bara vara av mindre värde jämfört med summan som betalas in. De får heller inte vara av en karaktär som jag i övrigt skulle kunna sälja i min verksamhet, allt enligt Skatteverkets regler.
Jag har satt ihop en rad olika belöningar som du kan välja på för olika sponsringsbelopp. Tanken är att det ska kännas som en gott-och-blandat-påse med godsaker. Mycket att välja på; vilken är din favorit? Kanske vill du ha två eller flera godsaker?
 
Även små stöd är viktiga - allt räknas dubbelt:
Du behöver inte känna dig dålig om du så bara skulle backa upp projektet med en krona eller en tia om det är vad du kan ge. Det finns en stor poäng i om du ändå vill göra det!
Det är nämligen så att den här insamlingen också kommer att visa på ANTALET PERSONER som deltar och backar upp projektet. Då syns det att det här är en jätteviktig satsning som si eller så många faktiskt vill se hända och jag har 'på fötter' när jag ska söka medel från andra håll. Tänk om det gick att visa att exempelvis 70% av alla som bor i Hammerdal/Jämtland (och bortom) vill att detta ska bli av. Eller att si och så många yrkesverksamma längtar efter att få komma till lokstallet på kurs när det är färdigt...

Vacker rostad skorsten från ånglokens tid
 
Framtiden med LOKSTALLET FIRE & HEART


Parallellt med det här första försöket att hitta ekonomi för ombyggnationen av lokstallet söks medel för en förstudie och ett första verksamhetsprojekt kallat 'LOKSTALLET FIRE & HEART - heta tekniker, heta möten'. Tanken är att kunna starta upp driften i ett spännande verksamhetsprojekt direkt när själva byggnaden står renoverad och klar. 


'Tänk att kunna få komma och bygga stort och hyra in sig på en spännande maskinpark!'
 
Utmaningar, kritik och tänkbara svar
Som alla förstår finns det saker som kan sätta käppar i hjulet för den här typen av satsning. Det mest uppenbara är naturligtvis att jag inte hittar de summor som krävs för att få igång den upprustning och verksamhet som är planerad. Men här har jag långt kvar till vägs ände - tvärtom har jag ju bara börjat.
Någon kanske tänker:
- Varför ska vi backa upp henne, hon är ju bara en av alla oss företagare i byn, varför ska vi vara med och betala just hennes satsning? Frågan är relevant och korrekt. Men det finns skäl:
Jag har drivit frågan om att något ska hända med lokstallet i drygt tre års tid och lagt otaliga obetalda timmar på att komma till den punkt när jag tar över fastigheten. Jag har spottat in mer pengar än jag tänker berätta i sammanhanget utan att kunna tjäna en enda krona på det. Bland annat för att jag inte vill bo i en by som inte gör något åt ett förfallande lokstall. Så här kan vi ju inte ha det!
Det finns mängder av andra personer i Hammerdal som har haft planer för lokstallet som aldrig blev av. Av någon fantastisk anledning har jag blivit betrodd med att ta över fastigheten. Det är nu eller aldrig det händer. Nu finns chansen att hjälpa till om man på riktigt tycker att det skulle vara viktigt för byn att vårt vackraste hus tas om hand.
Slutligen kan man ju tycka att det är oskäligt att ekonomiskt backa upp en enskild individs blivande ateljé. Siktet är visserligen inställt på en ateljé jag också kommer att förlägga mitt privata skapande - men överlag som min vision ser ut kommer det att i allra högsta grad sprida ekonomiska fördelar och även en del pur glädje till byn. 
En poäng till finns att göra. Min vision för lokstallet kommer nog alltid att ge mer tillbaka till byn och andra besökare än vad jag kommer att plocka ut i reda pengar. Inte den mest lukrativa planen ekonomiskt kanske, men förhoppningsvis en av de mer byabefrämjande planerna för lokstallet?!


'Det här kommer att bli en satsning som blir viktig både internationellt, nationellt och lokalt.'
 
Det finns OLIKA sätt att hjälpa till! 
Som yrkesverksam konstnär har jag full förståelse för att alla människor inte har råd att stödja lokstallsprojektet med ekonomiska medel. Men det finns ett antal andra saker du gärna får hjälpa till med istället:

Ett hett tips är att sprida ordet om att detta crowdfundingprojekt/denna insamling nu är påbörjad! Berätta gärna muntligt till släkt och vänner om projektet. En annan bra sak är om du har möjlighet att sprida informationen digitalt. Det gör du lättast genom att gilla och dela inlägg på Facebook/Twitter/Instagram osv. Ju fler som vet om insamlingen och dess mål och syfte/framtidsvision desto fler kan tänkas vilja bidra.
Kampanjen pågår bara några veckor så det är viktigt att informationen sprids SNABBT.
Sitter du på smågatsten/annan marksten eller ett par snuttar av riktig järnvägsräls som du vill skänka så tar jag tacksamt emot dem! Det gör inget om jag får sten i olika former och storlekar bara det är just sten. Mosaik är inte ett problem utan en konstnärlig möjlighet!

'Vi kommer att stötta det här - självklart ska vi göra det!' -Anders Pålsson, Fyrås Trä AB VARMT TACK till alla som läst hit ner - nu hoppas jag att du kommer på hur mycket du vill och kan bidra. Kika under menyn/rubriken 'perks' så ser du vad du får för tack för olika stöd. Jag har som sagt försökt hitta på något för alla, lite som en riktigt bra godisblandning och det kan även tillkomma fler PERKS under insamlingens gång!Jag hoppas att du hittar minst en smaskig godbit! (Eller flera.)-Hjärtligt tack för ditt stöd! /Åsa Maria Hedberg. For my English speaking friends;Help me to save the old train car house in Hammerdal to make an international art centre!Hey! My name is Åsa Maria Hedberg and I'm delighted to see you here! Here's all the information about the campain for those interested in background information and future vision.NB: The film is now subtitled and if You click each perk - most of them are translated! Any questions: just click Ask a question - and I will come running to help!Welcome!New train car house owner - Åsa Maria Hedberg - who needs some economical start-up help BackgroundI am a full time working artist-ceramicist-glass artist with my own business in Hammerdal, a tiny village in northern Sweden. We moved here in 2013 from Östersund, a small town upnorth in Sweden, but I grew up at the Swedish east coast. I have been living at many places, among them in Pietermaritzburg in SA and in Sunderland, UK, as I studied for my BA of Fine Arts.Now I have the great honor and and pleasure to take over the old train car house in Hammerdal!I am passionately fond of this train car house and ever since I first saw the property, I have worked hard to save and to make use of the building for the future, for the villagers, to the delight of tourists and to make it into an art centre!As the train car house is such a locally heartfelt project I first and foremost made this a project written in Swedish even though using an American site; Indiegogo. But now I realise I might just as well have some fans 'out there' that could be interested in supporting me and the cause. My vision is to make this into an international art scene, with the main focus on green tech in making art from clay and glass. Also to enable large scale works. So please join me for the explanaition of my vision - and bare with me if my language sometimes failes... my mother tongue is Swedish. ;) Vision:Lokstallet FIRE & HEART- Hot techniques, cordial meetingsLokstallet FIRE & HEART is all about hot technologies and cordial meetings between peopleAn international and local art create centers where the main materials are clay and glass.The volume and space in the old train car house will enable art making in the larger scale using an overhead crane for moving around the sculptures and materials. A planned walkway at the bottom edge of the ceiling will simplify the creation of larger works.  A course room as a house-in-the-house in the further endShort courses for full-time artists on BA and MAlevels and also for hobbyists...creates opportunities for both beginners courses in ceramics and glass, but intentions are also to collaborate with colleges and universities in Sweden and internationally. The vision is to give short courses at bachelor and master level located in the train car house.There has already been some interest from future partner schools to locate some courses to the train car house, when up and runAll courses and workshops held at LOKSTALLET will be broadcast live and many courses will be given as distancy studies should You not be able to come in person. This will connect makers and places. Probably, many makers-students will try their best to be in Hammerdal for the next course, perhaps applying for an artist-in-residence period. Sustainability and environmental concerns in focus from the startThe project of 'LOKSTALLET fire and heART' will start off as a green project from scratch. This will be a unique venture where everything from rebuilding of the house it self to the art making projects will be completely permeated by environmental considerations. Today there is no ceramic/glass art center that focuses entirely on the environmental aspect of creation.The sculpture park will also enhance the quality of life and the environment for all who live in Hammerdal and for temporary guests. Various ornamental trees will be planted and fruit and berries shall be for everyone to pick and enjoy. A soil analysis is made to ensure that the land is not soiled by the previous operations. There were no remarks. Artist in Residence/mini meetings/studioThe tower portion will hold a mini kitchenette and a handicap WC with shower downstairs. At the top floor of the tower a small nook that will house a resource and material library around the four walls with comprehensive facts about ceramic and glass art in architecture and landscape.This room will also be used as a mini studio. The plan is to furnish so that a guest lecturer/artist in residence will be able to stay for shorter periods.Hammerdals' most beautiful building, tower part in sun set Mini caféteria - sales counter - and a sneak peak into art makingEntering the main doors a guest will first see a sales counter and a mini cafeteria; basically a coffee machine and some sandwiches/snacks. An employee host-kiln technician/caretaker will meet up. If you choose to remain inside the train car house You will often be able to see some hot forming of glass or monumental sculpture in clay or other materials. Another day, large-format drawing is at hand. There will always be something new happening on the basis of which artists are in the house!Being the owner of the train car house I (Åsa Maria Hedberg) will be the artist most often at the site, but the idea of being able to open up to other artists to come and work in periods feels great.A mini café is planned for the entrance of LOKSTALLET International sculpture park with a focus on large scale works in glass and ceramicsShould You buy a cup of coffee and go out in the park surrounding the train car house You will find many nice places to sit down and enjoy the moment. The idea is to mount a new large scale sculpture every other year as a new addition to the park. Glass and ceramics will take turns: first a magically special glass sculpture, then a cool ceramic piece by an internationally recognized artist and so on. This is a core topic for me; ceramics and glass art in public sites are not very common in Swedish cityscapes and not in rural areas either and to some extent not so commen even indoors. Often, buyers are wrongly troubled that ceramics and glass will shatter or crack - perhaps lacking knowledge that ceramics and glass do work even for cold climate. I would like to change that! What do Hammerdal back through the engine shed FIRE & HEART?My hope is that an open art center in the heart of the village of Hammerdal will create positive values ​​in many stages. The wish is that everyone shall feel welcome, that this will be a meeting point where villagers can stop by for a cup of coffee - a fika as we say in Sweden - and for travelers/tourists to stop for rest and inspiration.The basis in having a set opening hours and a 24/7 open sculpture park I believe will create a feeling that the old train car house is lifted from being a scruffy backyard where anyone can smash windows and break in for fun - into a pride for all of us.The 'secret' plan is to hopefully open by autumn 2018 ...!Side of the old train car house and part of the sculpture park to be What money is needed - and what you get in return:The project to get the train car house rescued, refurbished and mildly rebuilt for it's new use can be seen in three stages:1. SUPER ACUTE COSTS: Subdivision expenses, land registration, information material and signage/outdoor lighting/clearing of undergrowth in the park/robot mower2. ACUTE AND ACUTE LESS REFURBISHING; both exterior and interior. Here is a mending the roofs, renovation of windows/doors/bricks the most immediate priority. This will need to be fixed a s a p, preferably before or during winter 2016-17.3. NON emergency expenses - but needed for the complete vision: new technology for greener making of ceramic and glass art, fundings for the first large-scale sculpture to be set in the park and coffee machineTo be able to get anywhere with this project the train car house will need to be subdivided from the apartment houses today belonging to the same property. The Swedish Land Survey Authority has mentioned a vague figure of around 55,000 SEK for this - 6348 US$, a sum I do not have today. As this is a once in a life time possibility when the apartments are sold, I feel I need to grab the opportunity. But the roof on the north nave and tower portion is in a really bad condition, this is the last chance to save the building...The process of subdivision of the estate has just begun. I also now hold a signed contract of the purchase of the property, As soon as economical means are at hand I will start the refurbishing.In the autumn of 2015, I received a 90% economical support from the County Administrative Board of Jämtland - Culture department for an investigation of the conditions of the train car house. This was implemented by a specialist on old industrial buildings. Here you will find a link to the document which in detail describes the conditions of the train shed. It also holds proposals for careful restoration/renewal of the building based on the new proposed use:http: ... //media.asamariahedberg.se/2016/03/%C3%85t(Only in Swedish.)Jamtli at site late fall/winter of 2015 to go through the condition of the train car houseKjell Gisterå, architect at GisteråSjöstrand, was included in the process. He has drawn a plan that suggests mild changes to the interior to allow for large scale sculpturing and art making in mainly ceramics and glass. The train car house currently has no floor, no water and sewer, no toilet... All these basics, plus a course room, a storage room, a kitchenette, a toilet with space for wheelchairs, a shower, a mezzanine and resource library/nook for guest artists in the tower are plotted here.You can look at the proposal for the refurbishing here:LINKS TO ARCHITECTURAL DRAWINGS PDF:http: ... //media.asamariahedberg.se/2016/09/Skiss-phttp: ... //media.asamariahedberg.se/2016/09/Skiss-phttp: ... //media.asamariahedberg.se/2016/09/Skiss-pPart of the architectural plans for the remake of the train car houseThe reconstruction is estimated to cost just over three million SEK -  roundly half a million US$. Additional to this will be the paving in front of the entrance, investments in sustainably sound production technology and some scarification and more in the sculpture park area.Buffer holes in the wall and other historical details in the train car house will be saved in the gentle refurbishing. (See the film for the buffer hole story from 94 year old Torsten Nilsson!)
Costs to coverHere is a list of costs for different parts of the LOKSTALLET renovation and remodeling, but before you have a look at the detailed list, I would like to make a clarification about this fundraising campaign:Every penny that can be collected here and now is deeply needed - primarily to cover the subdivision and other costs under paragraph one above.I am not so naive as to expect that the village people of Hammerdal and other nonresidential friends and train car house fans will be able or want to cover all the financial needs - I have many more ideas about where to look for financial resources for the implementation.Should the campain render larger sums - inshallah -, these will directly cover the renovation in the order of urgency. Stranger things have happened before - and the big dream would be that the roof could be mended ASAP and windows repaired so that the weather would stop eroding the house.The better the result of this campain, the closer Hammerdal would be to a saved train car house that opens up for the world to come and work in the open work shop, an open sculpture park with international artists and a mini caféteria.Tower part with old water tank on the right will be nook for guest artists and a resource library
COSTS - in detail:(Some figures omitted - ask if You need more detailed information!)THE ROOF OF THE NORTH SIDE OF THE NAVE and THE ROOF OF THE TOWER should have been refurbished at the very latest a couple of years ago and as such they can fall in any winter with heavy snow. Replacing the roofs is of absolute necessity. I would praise my lucky star if this campain would render enough money so this could be carried out during this winter or early spring 2017. Prel cost: 610 000 SEK. (This amount includes all roof top work including sheet metal and chimney repairs, materials, construction site ladders and more.)WINDOWS and DOORS that is not just holes for the wind to blow right through and which actually functions as in opening and closing. I would deem this to be the absolute priority No. 2. Prel cost: 140 000 SEK.RECONSTRUCTION OF THE FRONT DOOR that is now completely rickety with broken glass windows. Prel cost: SEK 100 000.MASONRY and REPAIRING of crest, bricks, plastering of interior walls. Prel cost: 227 000 SEK.CONCRETE FLOOR, RUNNING WATER and SEWAGE so that people working in the train car house will be able to go to the bathroom! Feels as third priority. Still right on the emergency level to at all be able to use the train car house for art making and to be open to the public. Prel cost: 660 000 SEK.A HOUSE-IN-THE-HOUSE COURSE ROOM plus KITCHENETTE where neither the clay humans freeze comes as priority No 4. Prel cost: 380 000 SEK.MEZZANINE with storage space and access to the upper tower room. Prel cost: 400 000.JOISTS in the new flooring of the tower room. Prel cost: 38 000.SIGNAGE and INFORMATION MATERIAL designed by Jamtli. Prel cost 19 500 SEK.COFFEE MACHINE/MINI CAFÉTERIA in the entrance of the train car house. I wish this already for next summer - but it cannot be prioritized... mending roofs and installing floors must come before coffee/tea and 'fika'. But just wait, a mini cafeteria will be there in time.PAVING including two railway track snippets to show the train car history in front of the entrance gates. This can only happen if I get loads of money OR if anyone would like to donate a few tons of small cobblestones and a couple of rail snippets... You never know! 'Refurbishing need to happen NOW, unless...!' Björn Olofsson, architectural consultant of Jamtli PERK means 'bait' and 'thank you gift' in one wordThe set up of a crowdfunding project means that people backing the cause also get some sort of 'PERK' - a thank you gift. To avoid the money I collect will be taxable, these can only be of less value than the amount actually given. Also, the perks may not be of a character that I otherwise could sell in my business, according to the Swedish Tax Agency's rules.I have put together a variety of rewards that you can choose from. The idea is that it should feel like a bag of sweets. Plenty to choose from; which is your favorite? Maybe you want to have two or more of the sweets? ALL support is important - everything will count twice:There is no need to feel bad if you want to back the project with a penny or a dollar if that's what you can give. There is a great point if you still want to do it!The fact is that this collection will also show the number of people involved that supports the idea. This will tell something about the initiative, that many people really want to see this future vision come true. I can refer to the number of participants when applying for other economical support. It would be terrific if I could say, 70% of all people living in Hammerdal Sweden - and beyond! - wants this to happen. Or that so and so many professionals yearn to get to the train depot to work or study at one of the courses when it is all set...Beautiful roasted chimney from the time of steam engine trains The future project 'LOKSTALLET fire & heART'Parallell to this crowdfunding campain trying to find finances for the refurbishing of the old train car house I also apply for funds for a feasibility study and an initial business project called 'Lokstallet FIRE & HEART - hot techniques, cordial meetings'. The idea is to be able to start up the work shop directly when the building is renovated and purposely rebuilt.'Imagine being able to work and build large and to rent top quality machinery!' CHALLANGES, CRITISISM and some potential ANSWERSAs everyone knows, there are things that can puta brake to a venture of this type. The most obvious of course, is that I do not find the sums required to start the refurbishments and activities as planned. But I have a long way to the end of the road - on the contrary, I have the only just begun this journey.Someone may think:- Why should we back her, she's just one of all small scale business owners in the village, why should we help her idea to come true? The question is relevant and accurate. Here are some reasons:I have pushed for something to happen with the old train car house in just over three years now working countless unpaid hours to get to the point when I now will take over the ownershop of the property. I've already used more money than I will tell you here, without being able to earn a single cent from it. One of the reasons I did that is because I do not want to live in a village that doesn't maintain such a beautiful building as our train car house. Something must be done!There are many people in Hammerdal who had plans for the train car house that never got around to it. For some amazing reason, I was entrusted to take over the property. It's now or never this will happen. Now is the chance to help out if You really think it would be important for the village and world that this marvellous building can be the proposed open art centre/cafeteria we all need.Finally, one might think that it is unfair to financially back up an individual's future studio. The intention is for me to use this house as my own private studio - but my vision for the train car house will most certainly be of economical value to the whole village and also render some sheer joy of art to us all.My vision for the train car house will probably always give more back to the village and other visitors than I will be able to earn economically. Perhaps not the most lucrative plan, but hopefully one of the more village enhancing ones when refurbishing the train car house?!'This will be an investment that will be important both internationally, nationally and locally.' There are DIFFERENT ways to help!As a professional artist, I fully understand that all people can not afford to support the train car house project financially. But there are a number of other things you are welcome to help with instead:
A hot tip is to spread the word about this crowdfunding project! Please tell your friends and family about the project. Another good thing is if you have the opportunity to spread the information digitally. The easy way to do that is by liking and sharing posts on Facebook/ Twitter/Instagram etc. The more people who know about the collection and future vision, the more likely will help.
The campaign will run only a few weeks so it is important that the information spread quickly.
Should You have small paving cobblestones and/or rail road metal snippets and want to donate them I'll gratefully accept! It does not matter if I get street stones in various measurements. Mosaic is not a problem, rather an artistic opportunity!
'We will support this - of course we'll do that!' -Anders Palsson, Fyrås Wood ABMANY THANKS to all who read down here - now I hope that You will consider how and much You can and want to contribute. Peek under the menu 'perks' and you'll see what You can get for various sums. I have tryed to make up something for everyone, a bit like a really good candy mix and I might also add perks as the campain continues!I hope that you will find at least one yummy 'treat'=perk! (Or more.)-A heartly thanks for your support! /Åsa Maria Hedberg.

story:
Short Summary

I LOVE making pots. It is a passion and an all engulfing obsession, and I’m quite good at it, having made pots over the last decade. I know a lot about throwing, glazing, handbuilding and all the things it takes to make a pottery. I first got involved with clay in 2005, originally handbuilding. I then apprenticed in a hand throwing workshop after this,and have been making ever since. Over the last few years I have continued my work with handthrown pottery and teaching handbuilt pottery, while developing several signature pieces and glazes.

After a decade of working voluntarily for a charity I had a serious crisis of health, and I found myself penniless, without any major qualifications, and without the capacity to work. But what I did have was a trade. I had a decade of practical experience making pottery and that's what I am setting out to do. On my difficult days having something pragmatic gives me the chance to put one foot in front of the other and do something constructive. For now it is to be a productive hobby as I get back to my feet and get active after a year of languishing, but with time I would like to grow towards professional production, sales, and chiseling out a living from what I do well.

So Why a Crowdfund?

I am living hand-to-mouth at the moment, living on less than €800 a month. I am limited in my capacity to work due to a preexisting disability and ongoing chronic health issues and my income and cost of living makes 'just saving' pretty much impossible. This work is something I can do, that I have a decade of successful experience with,  and because it is flexible, it can accommodate my health issues in a positive and affirming way.

I need to make a change. I really need a cash injection to hit the ground running. It's not a pie-in-the-sky dream - this will happen, one way or another, but it would be a lot easier and more immediate with a little help. A lot of people want something for nothing, but that is not what I am looking for. A crowdfund is a way for mutual return, where you positively contribute to my work, and I can offer the fruits of my labour in return. 

Your help means that I can do something useful again, regain some of the dignity that long-term illness takes away, and long-term work towards coming off illness related benefits.

What I Need

One of the things that I most struggle with in crowdfunding campaigns are goals with no accountability for where the money goes. So I'm accounting for where the money will go! If there are changes I will update you as we go. 

Kiln                                                             €2200

I have arranged to get a kick wheel and raw materials (all of which I am paying for), but beyond my grasp is a kiln. This is not by any stretch of the imagination all of the costs involved, with shelving, batts, tools, materials, a wheel, postage and more, but this would go a long way towards a good start. Besides, I don't want you to pay for everything as I'm balancing asking for help with self-reliance and working towards the dignity and character that comes from clambering to achieve something. I am trying to ask for help to cover the difficult to achieve costs through a crowdfund, but I am also continuing to spend money on all the OTHER costs (because again, not a handout but a leg up).

What You Get: The Perks

 

 

Years ago I started making these wonderfully eccentric cards from Avoca offcuts, the material for the occutupi/ jelly fish coming from Irelands most famous weavery in 100% wool. This is one of the only non pottery rewards on offer on this campaign.

These ceramic brooches depict the double spiral, the spiral inwards, to the souls home, and the spiral back out into the world. The cyclic nature of the spiral and its reflection in the art of the Celtic people is a rich and evocative image connecting us to our past, our roots, and with our own journey in the world. This design is hand produced in Ireland by an Irish potter, rooted in his own love of Celtic myth and art. Produced from an earthenware body, covered with a coloured transparent glaze this product comes in several variations. Some triple spiral brooches may also be available. Each brooch is approximately 1 3/4 inches/ 4cm across with a simple brooch mount to the rear. Designs are selected and sent at random.

These ceramic pendants depict the double spiral, the spiral inwards, to the souls home, and the spiral back out into the world. The cyclic nature of the spiral and its reflection in the art of the Celtic people is a rich and evocative image connecting us to our past, our roots, and with our own journey in the world. This design is hand produced in Ireland by an Irish potter, rooted in his own love of Celtic myth and art. Produced from an earthenware body, covered with a coloured transparent glaze this product comes in several variations. There may also be some triple spirals available. Each pendant is approximately 1 3/4 inches/ 4cm across with a cotton thonging hanging. Designs are selected and sent at random.

These joss stick/ incense burners are produced with terracotta, decorated with slip and covered in a transparent glaze. (NOTE: above example not glazed/ in production)

I make good mugs (and I'm regularly told as much). This picture is illustrative of some recent work from me. Over the course of this campaign I will be making a few hundred mugs, all with Celtic motifs including the double spiral, triple spiral, triquetra and more. With this reward you get a mug from this production run, and to sweeten the deal I'll include a Celtic Ceramic Brooch. 

I make good mugs (and I'm regularly told as much). This picture is illustrative of some recent work from me. Over the course of this campaign I will be making a few hundred mugs, all with Celtic motifs including the double spiral, triple spiral, triquetra and more. With this reward you get fourmugs from this production run, and to sweeten the deal I'll include four Celtic Ceramic Brooches.

Risks & Challenges

"So what if you don't reach your goal? How will we get our rewards?"

I aim to complete and ship ALL rewards within a MAXIMUM of 90 days of the campaign ending. Many of the rewards are completed and ready to ship (cards, brooches, necklaces). I will plug away at the rest for the duration of the campaign and aim to fulfill all perks BEFORE the projected date.

I hope to get the money to achieve my goals, HOWEVER, if I do not, I will complete orders in rented kiln space, or in a makeshift kiln. There is no risk to backers, regardless of outcome. I hope for the best, but have planned for all eventualities. With that security, and knowing you won't be waiting for an indeterminate time (as is unfortunately the case with many other crowdfunds), know that you are supporting a successful and worthwhile crowdfund, whatever the final tally.

Here is a timeline for the crowdfund and perk fulfillment:

Other Ways You Can Help

This isn't just about money. This is me reaching out to my community and asking for help. Help can take many forms and here are some other ways you can support me and this campaign.

  • Make some noise! Share this campaign far and wide. My personal reach isn't nearly as wide as I'd need, so I need your help. Tell your friends, plaster social media, shout it from the mountain top!
  • Not into crowdfunds? Or want something not on offer here? You can also commission work from me (paying in advance, or making a deposit, contributing to my crowdfund indirectly).
  • Have pottery equipment lying around? Offer me interesting stuff to get me on my way.
  • Is there something you can offer that I haven't thought of? Get in touch (info@imbasceramics.com) and share your idea. I am all for help of all kinds, so dont be shy about offering

Many thanks in advance for any support you can offer. It can make a real difference.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Benjamin Baker and I am a practicing and exhibiting artist from Melbourne, Australia. I am a recent graduate and have started to lay the foundations of my practice outside of the institutional framework. 

This Campaign will allow me to travel to the Healing Hill Art Space, Badisher, Morni
Hills and Chandigarh, in India, from October 29th to November 24th, 2018. 
Here I have been invited to show a new work and participate in the festival as an observer and an artist in residence.

I have limitations on my capacity to work. This makes it harder and harder to gather funds for opportunities like this. Reaching out and asking for help is now a big part of the transformation of my practice. This opportunity is only possible with your help and I would be deeply grateful for any contribution whatsoever. 

 

What I Need & What You Get.

This funding will cover my travel expenses to and from India as well as allowing me to stay and contribute in a comfortable position. For every donation I am willing to offer my services in many ways. 
 

Some examples of exchanges and appreciations

$5 : A warm Thank-you 

$10 - $25: a drawing or print from my large collection

$100: A painting for your home

story:
UPDATE- NEW STRETCH GOAL AND ADD-ON PERK FOR PORTRAITS!

Dear Friends, Family and Backers, 

I just passed the 100% mark of my initial goal, I am really psyched, as well as surprised to have received such a great response, and am deeply grateful for all the support .

Given the circumstances and success of the campaign, I am creating a " Stretch Goal" of $3200 additional dollars , which would be reached if I hit  195 % on the original goal bar above.

Whatever amount I raise, will be destined to expanding the series of paintings "The Descent of The Cherubs" , as well as to help pay for the expenses related to showing my work at Entijuanarte in Tijuana, MX and at F-A-M-A in Monterrey, MX, from October 4th-7th and November 8th-10th, 2019, respectively. Both Entijuanarte and FAMA are prominent mexican art fairs that offer space for a selection of young artists to represent themselves and showcase their work.

Its thanks to you that this campaign is really thriving, so I thought of  a fun add-on to the portrait and micro portrait perks:

In addition to receiving your portrait, you will receive a time-lapse video of your portrait being created !

Here is how it works:

 

Option #1 : Get a friend to back the campaign! 

If you have already done your part, you can  get someone else interested in the campaign  and make a contribution. All you have to do is send me that person´s email once he/she has become a backer, or have that person send me yours! so I can corroborate your connection. Once I have received this information, I will send you a confirmation email and add the time-lapse to your portrait order.

 

Option #2 : Repeat a contribution yourself!

Get a second micro portrait/ portrait commissioned of another loved one. Once you make your purchase, I will add the timelapse to your order, send you a confirmation email and voilá! 

 

Option #3: First time contribution!

If you haven't gotten a chance to make a contribution yet, choose any format of portrait as your perk before the 14th of August , and you will also receive a free timelapse !

 

For those who are new to this campaign, you will find all the details below

 

CAMPAIGN STORY---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

About me

I am a painter and graphic artist, born in Manhattan to an American father and an Italian mother, and raised in the US, El Salvador, Mexico and different regions of Spain. Currently, I divide my time between Oaxaca, Mexico City, and Xalapa, where my main studio is located, in the middle of a beautiful rainforest.  I have received professional training in classical oil painting, fresco, and the use of natural dyes, with artists like Shane Wolf, Kate Stone, Jesus Gonzalez Gutierrez and Maddalenna Forcella, in Mexico, Europe, the US and Canada. In addition, I have worked and studied with Fernando Sandoval, Abraham Torres, The Multimedia Center of the National Center of Arts of Mexico, Panoptico Atelier, DiezyMedia Collective, Edwin Salas and Fernando Bellver, among others, learning etching, marionette carving, photogravure, albumen and carbon printing, stenopeic film, stop motion animation, generative code, and digital art. Since 2010, I have also taught workshops in Mexico, Spain and Portugal on etching, marionette mechanisms, painting, and the application of natural dyes in silkscreen and graphic art. 

About my campaign

In November 2018, I began a new series of oil portraits which I now want to share with the world. These deeply felt works combine magical realism, the human figure, and anthropomorphic still lifes to produce eerie visual narratives on the labyrinth of the psyche and the human condition. The paintings address our contemporary spiral into global chaos and confusion, as well as human yearning for the quietude of nature and antiquity. I use dolls, masks, and other objects and draw from myth, archetype and religion, in a dark yet playful, childlike manner. The series is entitled: ¨ The Descent of the Cherubs."


 

Earlier this year, I took steps towards sharing this work outside of Mexico, becoming active on social media platforms, reaching out to the public and other artists, and I was recently one of 100 artists selected from around the world to showcase their work at the Other Art Fair (TOAF) this September 2019 in Los Angeles. Over the past eight years, TOAF, hosted by Saatchi Art, has led the way in discovering and nurturing new creative talent, allowing artists to forge direct relationships with potential buyers and gallerists. 

 

            

 


At present I am focusing on painting ¨The Descent of the Cherubs" while preparing this effort to raise the substantial amount of money I need to pay for the stand at the TOAF, and related expenses such as my flight to LA. If I manage to raise more than my goal below, I will reinvest whatever funds are left in art materials and production for the work I plan to show at Entijuanarte ( Tijuana, Mexico), another important art fair I was accepted for, currently scheduled for October 2019.  If I do not reach my goal, I will rely on my resourcefulness and whatever money I do manage to raise to attend TOAF with my best new work.

Finally, I want to thank friends and family who have helped with this campaign, making the video, documenting my work, and giving advice. I believe that when a community makes an effort to help an individual reach a goal, it is really important to show gratitude and practice reciprocity, as well as share the positive effects of the help given. Therefore, whatever the amount of your contribution, you will receive a personal thank you note and exclusive updates on my new work and the progress being made in the campaign. 

 


I HOPE THAT YOU WILL CONTRIBUTE TO MY CAMPAIGN IN ORDER TO RAISE THE FUNDS I NEED !!
 

Expenses I need to cover:

-Art materials for finishing the series (High quality cotton paper, canvas, stretchers, gesso, paintbrushes, solvents and oil paint): $500 USD

-A gallery booth measuring 16 linear ft. with overhead lighting = $1,680 + sales tax = $1,818.60 USD

-Round Trip Plane Ticket Mexico City- Los Angeles : $450 USD (this is an approximate cost)

-Framing and Installation of Work for the fair: $550 USD

- International Transaction Fee: $25

 

Total = $ 3,344 USD

 

Gifts

 

Here is a list of the gifts I will be offering in return for your support. I have tried to choose those that would be appealing to you, that reflect my creative talent, and that reinforce your choice to contribute, beyond the altruistic aspect of helping this campaign thrive.
 

$5 Personal Thank you note and exclusive updates of campaign and work progress. 

 

$10 High quality digital image of artwork for wallpaper for your laptop/ desk computer/ phone/tablet. 

 

$25 2 signed 6 x 9 in. high quality postcards of artwork with a personal handwritten thank-you note. Choose two from the selection of 11 images I am offering.

$45- 4 signed 6 x 9 in. high quality postcards of artwork with a personal handwritten thank-you note. Choose four from the selection of 11 images I am offering. 

                                

 

$85  An 1.8 x 2.4 in. commissioned original micro-oil portrait of your choice ( of yourself, your pet, kids, spouse, friend, plant!) . The portraits can be created from photographs as well as from life. 

 

 

 

$175- 1 signed traditional etching by the artist of a limited edition of 20, created in the prominent atelier of Fernando Sandoval in Oaxaca, Mexico . 

 

$190 Full size signed  limited edition gicleé print on cotton paper (See Perks for actual sizes, ranging from 15.7 x 31.5 in to 20 x 31 in. ) 4 images to choose from. 

 

 

 

 

$300 7 x 9 in. Original commissioned  oil portrait of your choice on primed high quality cotton paper.The portraits can be created from photographs as well as from life. 

$320 7 x 9 in. Framed original oil studies created for the series "The Descent of the Cherubs". Estimated Shipping October 2019. 

 

 

$ 550 30.7 x 43.3 in. Original  monotype.  (Collography etching with a unique background made with oil paint marbling on high quality arches cotton paper).  2 available. 

$750 16x24 in. Original commissioned Oil portrait of your choice on Dibond Aluminum composite panel or Belgian Linen. The portraits can be created from photographs as well as from life. 

 

I know that although many people may want to help, not everyone can afford to with money. Remember that you can also support me by sharing my campaign, using the share tool in Indiegogo, or sending it manually to friends and family via email or your social media accounts. Any bit of help is greatly appreciated! 

 

I will be adding some more perks, mainly new images to choose from in some of the categories listed above (images, art prints and original artwork) and offering discounts, as well as updates on new work and progress made as the campaign evolves, stay tuned! 

(Check out the FAQ section for some extra info on perks and common questions that may arise)

 

Thank you for reading, supporting and sharing!!

 

-----------------------------------------------------------------

 

TRADUCCIÓN AL ESPAÑOL:

Sobre Mi

Soy una pintora y artista gráfica, nacido en Manhattan, de padre estadounidense y madre italiana, y crecí en los Estados Unidos, El Salvador, México y diferentes regiones de España. Actualmente, divido mi tiempo entre Oaxaca, Ciudad de México y Xalapa, donde se encuentra mi estudio principal, en medio de un hermoso bosque de niebla.

 He recibido capacitación profesional en pintura al óleo clásica, al fresco y con el uso de tintes naturales, con artistas como Shane Wolf, Kate Stone, Jesús González Gutiérrez y Maddalena Forcella; en México, Europa, los Estados Unidos y Canadá. Además, he trabajado y estudiado con Fernando Sandoval, Abraham Torres, Taller Panóptico, el Centro Multimedia del CNA de México, el Colectivo DiezyMedia, Edwin Salas y Fernando Bellver, entre otros, en el área de grabado, tallado de marionetas, fotograbado, albúmina e impresión al carbón, cine estenopeico, animación stop motion, código generativo y arte digital. Desde 2010, he impartido talleres en México, España y Portugal sobre grabado, mecanismos de marionetas, pintura y la aplicación de tintes naturales en serigrafía y arte gráfico.

 

Sobre mi campaña

En noviembre de 2018, comencé una nueva serie de retratos al óleo que ahora quiero compartir con el mundo. Estas obras profundamente emotivas combinan el realismo mágico, la figura humana y las naturalezas muertas antropomórficas para producir narraciones visuales espeluznantes sobre el laberinto de la psique y la condición humana. Las pinturas abordan nuestra espiral contemporánea en el caos global y la confusión, así como el anhelo humano por la tranquilidad de la naturaleza y la antigüedad. Utilizo muñecas, máscaras y otros objetos, y me inspiro en los mitos, arquetipos y religiones, de una manera oscura pero juguetona. La serie se titula: ¨ El Descenso de los Querubines ".

 

 

A principios de este año, tomé medidas para compartir este trabajo fuera de México, participando activamente en plataformas de redes sociales, contactando al público y otros artistas, y recientemente fui uno de los 100 artistas seleccionados de todo el mundo para mostrar su trabajo en The Other Art Fair (TOAF), este septiembre, 2019 en Los Ángeles, California. En los últimos ocho años, TOAF, organizada por Saatchi Art, ha liderado el camino para descubrir y fomentar nuevos talentos creativos, permitiendo a los artistas forjar relaciones directas con potenciales compradores y galeristas.

 

En este momento me estoy enfocando en pintar "El Descenso de los Querubines" mientras preparo este esfuerzo para recaudar la cantidad sustancial de dinero que necesito para pagar el stand en el TOAF, y los gastos relacionados, como mi vuelo a Los Ángeles. Si logro recaudar más que la meta citada abajo, reinvertiré los fondos que queden en materiales de arte y producción para el trabajo que planeo mostrar en Entijuanarte (Tijuana, México), otra importante feria de arte para la que fui aceptada, actualmente programada para octubre de 2019. Si No alcanzo mi objetivo, haré uso de mi ingenio y del dinero que consiga recaudar para asistir a TOAF con mi mejor trabajo nuevo.

Finalmente, quiero agradecer a los amigos y familiares que han ayudado con esta campaña, haciendo el video, documentando mi trabajo y dando consejos. Creo que cuando una comunidad hace un esfuerzo para ayudar a una persona a alcanzar una meta, es realmente importante mostrar gratitud y practicar la reciprocidad, así como compartir los efectos positivos de la ayuda brindada. Por lo tanto, sea cual sea el monto de su contribución, recibirá una nota de agradecimiento personal y actualizaciones exclusivas sobre mi nuevo trabajo y el progreso realizado en la campaña.

 

 

ESPERO QUE PUEDAS CONTRIBUIR A MI CAMPAÑA PARA RECAUDAR LOS FONDOS QUE NECESITO!

 

 

Gastos que necesito cubrir

-Materiales de arte para terminar la serie (papel de algodón de alta calidad, tela, bastidores, gesso, pinceles, solventes y pintura al óleo): $ 500 USD

-Un stand en la feria TOAF que mide 1.5 m2 con iluminación superior = $ 1,680 + impuesto de ventas = $ 1,818.60 USD

Boleto de avión de ida y vuelta Ciudad de México - Los Ángeles: $ 450 USD (este es un costo aproximado)

-Enmarcado e instalación de obra para la feria: $ 550 USD.

- Cuota por Transacción Internacional Bancaria: $25 

 

Total = $ 3,344 USD

 

Regalos

Aquí hay una lista de los regalos que ofreceré a cambio de su apoyo. He tratado de elegir aquellos que les resulten atractivos, que reflejan mi talento creativo y que refuercen su deseo de contribuir, más allá del aspecto altruista de ayudar a que esta campaña prospere.

$ 5 USD Nota de agradecimiento personal y actualizaciones exclusivas de la campaña y del progreso en la serie.

 

$ 10 USD Imagen digital de alta calidad de alguno de mis trabajos para fondo de pantalla para su computadora portátil / computadora de escritorio / teléfono / tableta.

 

$ 25 USD 2 tarjetas postales firmadas de alta calidad de 17.78 x 22.86 cm. Con una nota de agradecimiento personal. Elija 2 postales de la selección mostrada en la imagen siguiente.

$ 45 USD 4 tarjetas postales firmadas de alta calidad de 17.78 x 22.86 cm. Con una nota de agradecimiento personal. Elija 2 postales de la selección mostrada en la imagen siguiente.

$ 85 USD 1 micro-retrato al óleo por encargo de tu elección (de ti, tu mascota, hijos, cónyuge, amigo, planta, etc) de 4.5 x 6 cm . Puedo realizar el retrato a partir de una foto o de una sesión en persona, dependiendo de la disponibilidad y cercanía. 

 

$ 175 USD 1 grabado tradicional firmado por la artista de una edición limitada de 20, creado en el destacado taller de Fernando Sandoval en Oaxaca, México - Dos imágenes para elegir. (las medidas se detallan en el apartado de regalos)

 

$ 190 USD Impresión giclée (de edición limitada de 80 piezas) en papel de algodón de tamaño equivalente a la pieza original, firmada por la artista. 

 

$ 300  USD Retrato original al óleo por encargo de tu elección  (de ti, tu mascota, hijos, cónyuge, amigo, planta, etc) en papel de algodón  imprimado de alta calidad de 17.78 x 22.86 cm. Puedo realizar el retrato a partir de una foto o de una sesión en persona, dependiendo de la disponibilidad y cercanía.  . 

$ 550 USD Monotipo original sobre papel de algodón de alta calidad de 78 x 110 cm. 2 disponibles.

 

$ 750 USD Retrato al óleo por encargo de tu elección  (de ti, tu mascota, hijos, cónyuge, amigo, planta, etc) en panel compuesto de aluminio Dibond o en  lino belga de 40.7 x 61 cm. Puedo realizar el retrato a partir de una foto o de una sesión en persona, dependiendo de la disponibilidad y cercanía. 

 

Sé que aunque muchas personas quieran ayudar, no todos pueden permitirse el lujo de hacerlo con dinero. Recuerda que también puedes apoyarme compartiendo mi campaña, usando la herramienta de compartir en Indiegogo o enviándola manualmente a amigos y familiares por correo electrónico o sus cuentas de redes sociales. Cualquier ayuda es muy apreciada!

 

Estaré agregando algunos beneficios adicionales, principalmente nuevas imágenes para elegir en algunas de las categorías enumeradas anteriormente (sobre todo imágenes para impresiones y obras de arte originales), y estaré ofreciendo descuentos en momentos clave, así como subiendo actualizaciones sobre nuevos trabajos y avances realizados a medida que evoluciona la campaña. Manténganse a la escucha!

(Échale un ojo a la sección de FAQs para ver info extra sobre los regalos, y respuestas a preguntas frecuentes sobre la campaña)

¡Gracias por leer, apoyar y compartir!
story_txt: UPDATE- NEW STRETCH GOAL AND ADD-ON PERK FOR PORTRAITS!Dear Friends, Family and Backers, I just passed the 100% mark of my initial goal, I am really psyched, as well as surprised to have received such a great response, and am deeply grateful for all the support .Given the circumstances and success of the campaign, I am creating a " Stretch Goal" of $3200 additional dollars , which would be reached if I hit  195 % on the original goal bar above. Whatever amount I raise, will be destined to expanding the series of paintings "The Descent of The Cherubs" , as well as to help pay for the expenses related to showing my work at Entijuanarte in Tijuana, MX and at F-A-M-A in Monterrey, MX, from October 4th-7th and November 8th-10th, 2019, respectively. Both Entijuanarte and FAMA are prominent mexican art fairs that offer space for a selection of young artists to represent themselves and showcase their work.Its thanks to you that this campaign is really thriving, so I thought of  a fun add-on to the portrait and micro portrait perks:In addition to receiving your portrait, you will receive a time-lapse video of your portrait being created !Here is how it works: Option #1 : Get a friend to back the campaign! If you have already done your part, you can  get someone else interested in the campaign  and make a contribution. All you have to do is send me that person´s email once he/she has become a backer, or have that person send me yours! so I can corroborate your connection. Once I have received this information, I will send you a confirmation email and add the time-lapse to your portrait order. Option #2 : Repeat a contribution yourself!Get a second micro portrait/ portrait commissioned of another loved one. Once you make your purchase, I will add the timelapse to your order, send you a confirmation email and voilá!  Option #3: First time contribution!If you haven't gotten a chance to make a contribution yet, choose any format of portrait as your perk before the 14th of August , and you will also receive a free timelapse ! For those who are new to this campaign, you will find all the details below CAMPAIGN STORY---------------------------------------------------------------------------------About meI am a painter and graphic artist, born in Manhattan to an American father and an Italian mother, and raised in the US, El Salvador, Mexico and different regions of Spain. Currently, I divide my time between Oaxaca, Mexico City, and Xalapa, where my main studio is located, in the middle of a beautiful rainforest.  I have received professional training in classical oil painting, fresco, and the use of natural dyes, with artists like Shane Wolf, Kate Stone, Jesus Gonzalez Gutierrez and Maddalenna Forcella, in Mexico, Europe, the US and Canada. In addition, I have worked and studied with Fernando Sandoval, Abraham Torres, The Multimedia Center of the National Center of Arts of Mexico, Panoptico Atelier, DiezyMedia Collective, Edwin Salas and Fernando Bellver, among others, learning etching, marionette carving, photogravure, albumen and carbon printing, stenopeic film, stop motion animation, generative code, and digital art. Since 2010, I have also taught workshops in Mexico, Spain and Portugal on etching, marionette mechanisms, painting, and the application of natural dyes in silkscreen and graphic art. About my campaignIn November 2018, I began a new series of oil portraits which I now want to share with the world. These deeply felt works combine magical realism, the human figure, and anthropomorphic still lifes to produce eerie visual narratives on the labyrinth of the psyche and the human condition. The paintings address our contemporary spiral into global chaos and confusion, as well as human yearning for the quietude of nature and antiquity. I use dolls, masks, and other objects and draw from myth, archetype and religion, in a dark yet playful, childlike manner. The series is entitled: ¨ The Descent of the Cherubs." Earlier this year, I took steps towards sharing this work outside of Mexico, becoming active on social media platforms, reaching out to the public and other artists, and I was recently one of 100 artists selected from around the world to showcase their work at the Other Art Fair (TOAF) this September 2019 in Los Angeles. Over the past eight years, TOAF, hosted by Saatchi Art, has led the way in discovering and nurturing new creative talent, allowing artists to forge direct relationships with potential buyers and gallerists.               At present I am focusing on painting ¨The Descent of the Cherubs" while preparing this effort to raise the substantial amount of money I need to pay for the stand at the TOAF, and related expenses such as my flight to LA. If I manage to raise more than my goal below, I will reinvest whatever funds are left in art materials and production for the work I plan to show at Entijuanarte ( Tijuana, Mexico), another important art fair I was accepted for, currently scheduled for October 2019.  If I do not reach my goal, I will rely on my resourcefulness and whatever money I do manage to raise to attend TOAF with my best new work.Finally, I want to thank friends and family who have helped with this campaign, making the video, documenting my work, and giving advice. I believe that when a community makes an effort to help an individual reach a goal, it is really important to show gratitude and practice reciprocity, as well as share the positive effects of the help given. Therefore, whatever the amount of your contribution, you will receive a personal thank you note and exclusive updates on my new work and the progress being made in the campaign.  I HOPE THAT YOU WILL CONTRIBUTE TO MY CAMPAIGN IN ORDER TO RAISE THE FUNDS I NEED !! Expenses I need to cover:-Art materials for finishing the series (High quality cotton paper, canvas, stretchers, gesso, paintbrushes, solvents and oil paint): $500 USD-A gallery booth measuring 16 linear ft. with overhead lighting = $1,680 + sales tax = $1,818.60 USD-Round Trip Plane Ticket Mexico City- Los Angeles : $450 USD (this is an approximate cost)-Framing and Installation of Work for the fair: $550 USD- International Transaction Fee: $25 Total = $ 3,344 USD Gifts Here is a list of the gifts I will be offering in return for your support. I have tried to choose those that would be appealing to you, that reflect my creative talent, and that reinforce your choice to contribute, beyond the altruistic aspect of helping this campaign thrive. $5 Personal Thank you note and exclusive updates of campaign and work progress.  $10 High quality digital image of artwork for wallpaper for your laptop/ desk computer/ phone/tablet.  $25 2 signed 6 x 9 in. high quality postcards of artwork with a personal handwritten thank-you note. Choose two from the selection of 11 images I am offering.$45- 4 signed 6 x 9 in. high quality postcards of artwork with a personal handwritten thank-you note. Choose four from the selection of 11 images I am offering.                                  $85  An 1.8 x 2.4 in. commissioned original micro-oil portrait of your choice ( of yourself, your pet, kids, spouse, friend, plant!) . The portraits can be created from photographs as well as from life.    $175- 1 signed traditional etching by the artist of a limited edition of 20, created in the prominent atelier of Fernando Sandoval in Oaxaca, Mexico .  $190 Full size signed  limited edition gicleé print on cotton paper (See Perks for actual sizes, ranging from 15.7 x 31.5 in to 20 x 31 in. ) 4 images to choose from.     $300 7 x 9 in. Original commissioned  oil portrait of your choice on primed high quality cotton paper.The portraits can be created from photographs as well as from life. $320 7 x 9 in. Framed original oil studies created for the series "The Descent of the Cherubs". Estimated Shipping October 2019.   $ 550 30.7 x 43.3 in. Original  monotype.  (Collography etching with a unique background made with oil paint marbling on high quality arches cotton paper).  2 available. $750 16x24 in. Original commissioned Oil portrait of your choice on Dibond Aluminum composite panel or Belgian Linen. The portraits can be created from photographs as well as from life.  I know that although many people may want to help, not everyone can afford to with money. Remember that you can also support me by sharing my campaign, using the share tool in Indiegogo, or sending it manually to friends and family via email or your social media accounts. Any bit of help is greatly appreciated!  I will be adding some more perks, mainly new images to choose from in some of the categories listed above (images, art prints and original artwork) and offering discounts, as well as updates on new work and progress made as the campaign evolves, stay tuned! (Check out the FAQ section for some extra info on perks and common questions that may arise) Thank you for reading, supporting and sharing!! ----------------------------------------------------------------- TRADUCCIÓN AL ESPAÑOL:Sobre MiSoy una pintora y artista gráfica, nacido en Manhattan, de padre estadounidense y madre italiana, y crecí en los Estados Unidos, El Salvador, México y diferentes regiones de España. Actualmente, divido mi tiempo entre Oaxaca, Ciudad de México y Xalapa, donde se encuentra mi estudio principal, en medio de un hermoso bosque de niebla. He recibido capacitación profesional en pintura al óleo clásica, al fresco y con el uso de tintes naturales, con artistas como Shane Wolf, Kate Stone, Jesús González Gutiérrez y Maddalena Forcella; en México, Europa, los Estados Unidos y Canadá. En los últimos ocho años, TOAF, organizada por Saatchi Art, ha liderado el camino para descubrir y fomentar nuevos talentos creativos, permitiendo a los artistas forjar relaciones directas con potenciales compradores y galeristas. En este momento me estoy enfocando en pintar "El Descenso de los Querubines" mientras preparo este esfuerzo para recaudar la cantidad sustancial de dinero que necesito para pagar el stand en el TOAF, y los gastos relacionados, como mi vuelo a Los Ángeles. story:
Summary

Hi everyone, My name is Daniel Sergio. Im a singer, songwriter and pastor out of Madison In (orig. from FL) and I am so excited about what God has put on my heart and the burden I have to release the things he's given me through song. I know that God can move through just one song... even just a sentence. thats why I'm first starting out with this single. I truly believe being faithful with the small will lead to being trusted with the large

What I Need & What You Get

so, the number is $1600.00

this will take care of many things including recording time. my Producer Johnathan Johnson, mixing, mastering, an honorarium for the musicians, (I wanna bless the ones who choose to partner with me) theres gonna be food i get for the crew, travel expense. And technically I'm spending more than the projected amount, so I'm pouring into this just like you guys.

Any  gift amount will get you the single.

Any gift over $35.00 will get you the single. And will get you a personal message from me to you.

Anything over $100.00 will get you the single. And I'll record a live video of me giving a personal message

anything over $200.00 I would be more than happy to give you the single, do a live video of me giving a personal message and an acoustic version of the song.

Any church or organization that gives a $500.00 gift or greater I will come lead a worship session at your church

 If we are not able to meet the goal, the musicians I'm working with are my friends and have already told me they would work for free. I just want to bless them. what I do raise will go solely to the production of the track.

The Impact

Through out this the theme has been about the parable with the mustard seed that Jesus talks about and being faithful with the small. With Ignited music, we landed 72 on the top 100 charts for christian music. And even though the numbers aren't what I focus on, its important to know that the guys Im working with are truly talented and likeminded... We all want to see people's mountains shifted and transformed by the same small seeds God placed in us so long ago. Please partner with me to help that idea come to fruition through song. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't give financially its okay. One of the other things I need, probably more than the finances, is your support through social media. the first thing God did was speak, not give money, so if you would help just by speaking up about this project, you're already an MVP in my book

On Behalf of my wife Raquel Sergio and I, a BIG BIG BIG Thank you to all who help me in this season. We love and appreciate all of you. Be blessed

We all want to see people's mountains shifted and transformed by the same small seeds God placed in us so long ago. Please partner with me to help that idea come to fruition through song. 

    Other Ways You Can Help If you can't give financially its okay. One of the other things I need, probably more than the finances, is your support through social media. the first thing God did was speak, not give money, so if you would help just by speaking up about this project, you're already an MVP in my book
On Behalf of my wife Raquel Sergio and I, a BIG BIG BIG Thank you to all who help me in this season. We love and appreciate all of you. Be blessed

story:
What is a Merkaba?

The Merkaba transcends history and culture. This symbol is found in many sacred text and its meaning interpreted in many ways. In Jewish teachings the Merkaba represents Ezekiel's Chariot, used to ascend to the Throne of God. It has also been said that the Egyptian god, Ra, used the Merkaba to travel between our plane of existence and those of higher consciousness. In my personal exploration, the Merkaba has transported my spirit to states of Enlightenment. There is a deep connection between the Chakras and the Balance of our personal Merkabas.

 

What is the Merkaba Inner SpaceShip?

M.I.S.S. is an interactive physical representation of the Merkaba. Each point on the star-tetrahedron (Merkaba shape) will represent one of the 7 major Chakras. The panels will have symbols & sacred geometry cut into every side. Each of the points will shine one of seven distinct colors of light to match the color of that Chakra. You will be able to climb inside the Merkaba and have a transcending experience guided by sound. The highest point (Crown Chakra) will be adorned with infinity mirrors to expand awareness.

 

Who is making this thing?

The project is brought to you by the High Noon Village. The idea came about first as a concept for a Temple, however it has evolved and expanded into the interactive awesomeness that is about to become. My name is Bacon, and I'm the project lead. I've delivered on multiple art-grant funded and personally funded projects in the past including:

  • "The Freaky Deeky Time Machine Dance Floor" - push a button to select a time period, music plays, lights kick on, and people dance. (Flipside 2012)
  • "NOMIS" - interactive game of pattern matching, known as Simon, played out with flame cannons and awesome sound effects. (Myschievia 2013)
  • "The Fire COSM" - 4 person interactive DJ station, press buttons, twist knobs, and slide sliders, to collaborate, create, and effect music, with tempo synced fire cannon, naturally. (Flipside 2014, Myschievia 2014)
  • "Tripp's Pyramid of Cubes & the Oblisk" - interactive projection mapped visuals on LED backed cubes. (Freezerburn 2015-16, Flipside 2016)
  • "High Noon Saloon Doors" - The entry way to High Noon, these saloon style doors fire boosh cannons as you walk or kick your way through them! (Freezerburn 2016, Flipside 2016)

I could not have completed any of these projects without the amazing village that is High Noon. We are assembled and ready to commence the build for our latest project, the Merkaba Inner SpaceShip! This time we are looking for some help from our community.

 

The Budget

The planned budget for the project is around $1400. We are incredibly grateful, and thrilled to announce that we received funding through an art grant from Freezerburn for the amount of $599!!! Huge thanks to everyone who purchased an art grant ticket to FZB! This left us needing $800 to make it happen. I started the fundraising by adding in $50, and now I'm opening it up to the community through this Indiegogo campaign to raise $750.

The beauty of indiegogo is that even if we only raise $500 the money will still go to the project, so its ok if we don't meet the total goal. I will supply any additional funding needed to make this project happen in the event that we don't hit our community funding goal of $750. On the contrary, if we go over our goal all additional funds will go directly to High Noon and be reflected back to the community in the form of gifts at FZB.

Below is a breakdown of the budget. I have tried to be as accurate as possible and ensure that everything is covered. We are building this project to last, in hopes of bringing it to all of the Texas regional events this coming year!

The Breakdown

Wood - $400

  • 36 panels, birch wood, $300
  • 2"x 4"'s, $65
  • 4"x 4", support post, $10
  • seat panel (thicker), $25

Lights - $350

  • bright white bulbs, $80
  • bulb sockets, $25
  • electrical wire >56', $20
  • electrical plugs, $25
  • colored film, 10 colors 10m each, $150
  • rentals, supplemental lights for around the area, $50

Speakers $150

  • 2-4 speakers, $50-100
  • receiver/control, $50

Infinity Mirrors $100

  • LED light strips $25
  • glass $25
  • screens/monitors $50

Support system $50

  • anchors $45
  • cable/wire $5

Stain/Paint $50

  • >1 gallon of white stain or paint $45
  • brushes/paint supplies $5

Hardware $100

  • screws, brackets, tools, misc., things we are not thinking of... $100

Transportation $200

  • Rental price for box truck $200

Total - $1400

This is the dream. If we come up short we will reduce cost and fund it internally.

Thank you all for your contribtions!

 

 

 

The Plan

The structural design is nearly complete. Next week we will begin chopping lumber and assembling the (8) mini 3-sided pyramids that will make up the Merkaba. We will be cnc routing the art design into the panels, then wiring the lights, and adding the tinted film to make each one its own color of the rainbow. The outside will be stained/painted white. We are going to construct infinity mirrors in the crown chakra pyramid as well. All of this is to be done on a pretty tight timeline, but I'm sure we can complete it in time for FZB. Also anyone in the community is welcome to help us build! We are going to be working around William Cannon and Manchaca. Feel free to direct message me for details.

 

Perk Party

We are going to throw a party on Sunday December 18th for people who back our campaign to pick up their perks in person! So if you threw down for a dozen cookies, your cookies will be waiting for you at the party. If you got a hair cut as your perk, then you can get your hair cut at the party! Even if you didn't back the project, you are welcome to come by for some classic High Noon style good times. More details on this to follow! Please note that this is the same weekend as the final FZB work weekend, and we encourage everyone to make it out to the land on Friday and Saturday to help prep for the event, then come dance your asses off with us on Sunday.

story:
Jetting around the world documenting r/c races is a moderately expensive proposition. Our page features no advertising, so our project is entirely self-funded. We ask those members of the hobby community who enjoy our images to please donate to our cause, so we may continue to bring you the best racing photos possible. All funds raised will go towards travel expenses, as well as periodic photo equipment requirements. Look for us at the following events:

Byron Fuels On-Road Challenge – Leisure Hours Raceway

ROAR 1/8th E-Buggy Nationals – Stateline RC Raceway

Futaba OS Challenge – St Louis Dirt Burners

Monsters of the Midwest Off-Road Series

International Indoor Champs – Westgate Las Vegas

IFMAR 1/8th Off-Road World Championship – RC Tracks of Las Vegas

And Many More!

Thank you for supporting our cause, and see us now at https://www.facebook.com/burnoutrc/

story:
My name is Fanny Penny.  I design and create jewelry, art, and home goods from clay and fiber.

Since the start of my business in 2012, I've been firing my work in community kilns.  This year, I made the leap toward creative independence by purchasing my own kiln.  Finally!  I can't illustrate enough what a difference this is going to make for my productivity.  In the past, I've had to wait several weeks for a firing. Now, I'll be able to fill orders quicker, get better yields on my product, and achieve far more predictable results. It's a total game changer for my business.

This is where you come in.  Cherished friend, fellow artist, fellow mother, contemporary, member of my community; I ask for your support.  I need to raise $2,500, and the funds will be used for the following...

1.  To install the necessary 220 voltage to run the kiln
2.  To build a small structure to house the kiln

These funds will allow me to continue building my business, reach my creative goals, and share the wealth that comes with entrepreneurship.  With that intention in mind, I plan to donate 5% of proceeds to Lotus Outreach, an incredible non-profit dedicated to bringing education and economic empowerment to women in India and Cambodia.  Click here to learn more.

Consider pitching in and share my campaign with your friends.  There's a bright future ahead, made brighter by our ability to take care of ourselves and our families holistically.  It takes a village, y'all.  

Mucho love,
- Fanny

story:
Short Summary

Hello Family, Friends, and Potential Investors,

My name is Julian Magloire.  I am from Brooklyn, NY, and I'm in the process of producing a photo book entitled "Peace".  "Peace" would be a collection of historical interpretations through photos.  It involves many different cultures, religions, and theories that are present today.  If I am able to reach my goal, I would continue developing a strategy for marketing the book to touch the hearts of my local community.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to reach this goal, the estimated amount I would need to create this book efficiently would be $3000.  The money would be used to rent photography and videography equipment, purchase props, hire models, transportation expenses, and last but not least, print at least 10  books to start.  The equipment rental alone is around $950 for a week.  Now whatever is actually raised would alter some plans to make this done the best way possible, but any contribution would still help the project make a step to come alive.

  • I know people some people love to design their homes with furniture, art, or many other items. As a perk, I would like to contribute to the beauty of your home or office space.  
  • If you donate $100 or more, I will email a list of abstract photographs that I have taken, and I will print it on a 16x16 canvas to contribute to the overall design of your home or office. In addition, there will be a video production that goes along with the photo-book on youtube. I will list your name as a sponsor for the project in the ending credits.
  •  If $50 is contributed, I will email the same list of abstract photographs, and whichever photo you choose, I will print an 8x10 photo and place it in a beautiful frame. In addition, there will be a video production that goes along with the photo-book on youtube. I will list your name as a sponsor for the project in the ending credits.
  •  If $25 is contributed, I will email the same list of abstract photographs, and whichever you choose, I will print a 4x6 photo and put it in a beautiful frame.  
  • If the contribution is up to $24, I will list your name as a sponsor for the project in the video production that goes along with the photo-book on youtube.

The Impact

  • Every contribution matters, even if it is a $1.  The purpose of this book is to inform readers of historical events, and also to open their minds to decipher my interpretations through doing their own research on the topics.
  • I have worked on a lot of successful projects with a production group called x|posure and was the Editor-in-Chief of my university's yearbook.  If you know me, you know I'm very passionate about my projects. If you don't, trust me and contribute to my project to see how this can potentially impact peoples lives.

Thank you for taking the time to visit my campaign page. Your support matters most of all, but your contributions can make a difference.  Please help make this project come to life. 

Love Always,

Julian Magloire
