story:
Mizna is bringing revolutionary Arab street art to St. Paul.

UPDATE: All donors at the $25 level will be invited to the VIP gathering withe Hend Kheera on Thursday, June 6!

ANOTHER UPATE: See all our artists' stencil designs right now. Check out the actual "Updates" tab above. Which one will you choose for your custom-made perk poster?

Mizna is participating in Northern Spark, a major Twin Cities all-night art festival on June 8! (Yeah, you read that right—ALL NIGHT, dusk to dawn.) It's a participatory street art project, and we want you to join us!

Underpass of the Eyes of Freedom will bring the spirit of the recent and ongoing Arab revolutions and uprisings to St. Paul. Festival goers are called to wander into an underpass of the Arab Spring: Take a spray can, an Arabic stencil: reinscribe potent global expressions of resistance and change. Including comissioned graffiti designs by Hend Kheera, Islam Shabana, Hamza Salim, and Dunya Alwan. At the Cairo Café that will await you in the underpass, you can peruse a copy of the Visual Guide to the Arab Spring written for us by visual culture scholar Nama Khalil. It sounds amazing, right? 

 

Cairo artist Hend Kheera will be joining us for Northern Spark!

Hend Kheera is a visual artist and courageous participant in the street art movement that has played a vital role in the Egyptian revolution and its aftermath. Read about Hend in this Rolling Stone article.

 

Echoing the words of resistance sprayed across the walls of the Arab Spring.

In the spirit of Mizna’s literary mission and focus on Arab experience, this installation is meant to fuse for participants a tactile encounter with a foreign language, distant trials of political empowerment, and a universally popular art form. It’s a touch of what’s been happening in Arab countries on the street, beyond the news stories. As Occupy Wall Street and other local and national movements here have shown, the aspirations for freedom and political agency across the world are akin to our own. 

 

What is the Underpass of the Eyes of Freedom?

Mohamed Mahmoud Street borders Tahrir Square in Cairo, Egypt. It is also known as "Street of the Eyes of Freedom" in honor of those who were wounded during protests. Emblematic of other public spaces in revolutionary Arab countries, this street is a site of provocative and vibrant street art, rendering an ongoing dialogue of the emerging realities of democratization. This project title is in tribute to that extraordinary place, and is rooted in our Northern Spark site which is quite literally an underpass. With Underpass of the Eyes of Freedom, Mizna invites festival-goers to pay homage to this site of art-as-activism and engage in a simple, creative gesture of solidarity.

 

How can you help make this happen?

Be a part of helping Mizna create this spectacular event by donating to this campaign. We are so excited to bring this revolutionary project to the all-night art festival Northern Spark, and we're stretching our modest organizational budget to do it! We would be so grateful for your support.

Here are some examples of what your support can do:

  • $50 pays for face masks to keep participants safe
  • $100 pays for a stop-motion camera to capture the entirety of this installation
  • $250 pays for 50 cans of spray paint
  • $500 pays for stencil material and stencil cutting
  • $1000 pays for an airline ticket to bring Hend Kheera from Cairo, Egypt

Supporting our festival at any amount will be very much appreciated!

Get the word out to your friends! Use e-mail, Facebook, Twitter, and word-of-mouth to get your community engaged and excited! We cannot do this without you!

 

And see you at Northern Spark!

story:
29/07/2013

 

Finally I can show you the first shoots of the Wonderwall!!!

 

 

 

 

 

Photographers: Enrico Odano and Paolo Inselvini

Site www.io-studio.it

 

27/05/2013

Hello everybody,
I want to truly thank everybody who helped me and believed in me. For me your support has been very important. The project was a success. Now I will have to work a lot, it will be done with a big smile and a great awareness: I can and I want to continue to pursue the path of art.

Ciao a tutti,
Voglio sinceramente ringraziare tutti quelli che mi hanno aiutato e hanno creduto in me. Per me è stato davvero importante. Il progetto è stato un successo. Ora ci sarà tanto tanto da lavorare, verrà fatto con un grande sorriso e una grande consapevolezza: posso e voglio continuare a percorrere la strada dell'arte.

 

 

Hello! My name is Sara, I’m half Italian and half Bajan, and ever since I was a child I have cultivated the passion for art in all its forms and expressions.

Over the years, my vicissitudes prevented me from continuously dedicating myself to this passion. Only lately I could breathe easy and finally take on painting. You can find some samples of my art on my website: www.sarazanocchio.com

Meanwhile, for a long time I have worked in close contact with the world of design and furniture, so I felt a growing need to express myself also through sculpture and art installations.

Then I decided to create the WonderWall, a wall sprinkled with coloured tits - ghostly drops yearning to amuse, surprise, obsess and keep you company! The art installation is composed by 15 handmade pieces, in 3 sizes and shapes of various colours. It’s called Will-o’-the-Tits!

 

Ciao a tutti! Mi chiamo Sara, sono metà italiana e metà Barbadiana, sin da bambina ho coltivato la passione per la pittura e l’arte in tutte le sue forme ed espressioni.

Le mie vicissitudini, negli anni, mi hanno impedito di applicarmi continuativamente a queste mie passioni. Solo recentemente ho potuto tirare un po’ il fiato e dedicarmi, finalmente, alla pittura.Potete trovare alcuni miei lavori direttamente sul mio sito: www.sarazanocchio.com

Lavorando per anni a contatto con il mondo dell’arredamento e del design ho sentito una crescente necessità di esprimermi anche attraverso la scultura e le installazioni.

Ho quindi deciso di creare il WonderWall, una parete costellata di seni colorati, gocce spettrali desiderose di tenervi compagnia, ossessionarvi, divertivi e stupirvi. L’installazione è composta da 15 pezzi fatti a mano uno ad uno, di 3 dimensioni e forme in vari colori, chiamate Will-o’-the-Tits!

 

Here below a sketch of the project:

Qui sotto una bozza del progetto:

3 reasons why it’s so crucial to have your grant and support:

- In order to fully realize my project, I need to cover the costs for all of the materials, essential tools and a photobook by a professional photographer.

- I wish to share the idea for my first art installation with as many people as possible, thanks to the Internet and Indiegogo.

- This project is original and funny! It allows to turn a wall in your house into a true WonderWall that’ll be the envy of all your friends! Have you ever desired to have an entire wall sprinkled with tits? I have indeed!!!

Please help make come true such a small dream, but so important to me!

 

Per me è molto importante avere il vostro contributo e il vostro aiuto per 3 principali motivi:

- attuare il progetto nella sua interezza, coprendo i costi dei materiali, degli strumenti indispensabili per la sua creazione e quelli richiesti per la realizzazione di un book fotografico con l’ausilio di un fotografo professionista.

-condividere la mia idea e la mia prima installazione, grazie ad internet e Indiegogo, con più persone possibili.

- Il progetto è originale e divertente, poter rendere una parete di casa vostra un vero e proprio Muro delle Meraviglie farà l’invidia di tutti i vostri amici! Chi non ha mai desiderato un’intera parete costellata di tette? Io sì!!!

Aiutatemi a realizzare questo piccolo sogno, ma per me importantissimo!

 


Sculpture Large Will-o'-the-Tit (the colour can change)

(15x28.5x8cm - 6x11x3 inches)

       

 

 

Sculpture Medium Will-o'-the-Tit (the colour can change) 

(11x20x6cm - 4.5x8x2.5 inches)       

 

 

 

 

Sculpture Small Will-o'-the-Tit (the colour can change)

(8x15x5cm - 3x6x2 inches)

                           

                    

Process

All the pieces are first drawn and then shaped by hand, using a modeling paste composed by a base of wax. Then I create the mold pouring slowly silicone.

Once I obtained the mold I pour inside it a two-component silicone with microballs, that makes the final product light but resistant.

Then I sand the tit so I can take any imperfection away, I cover it by brushing it with a primer for three times that will permit the future color to stick and finally I paint it.

The last step, right after the coloring, consists of a hand of plasticizer which makes the piece of art long-lasting.

Voilà! A beautiful colored boob ready to be exhibited!

All the pieces are signed and numbered.

 

Procedimento

Tutti i pezzi vengono prima disegnati e poi plasmati a mano, utilizzando una pasta modellabile a base di cera. Vengono poi creati degli stampi con colate di silicone.

Una volta ottenuti gli stampi viene versato al loro interno un bicomponente siliconico misto a microballs, che rendono il prodotto finale leggero ma resistente.

Poi il seno viene carteggiato e rifinito togliendo le imperfezioni, si da poi un fondo per tre volte che permette al futuro colore di aderire e, infine, viene colorato.

L’ultimo step, subito dopo la colorazione, prevede una passata di plastificante che rende il prodotto duraturo e resistente nel tempo.

E voilà, una bellissima tetta colorata tutta da mostrare!

 

Perks

Digital wallpaper

$5 pledges receive this Digital Wallpaper:

1024x768 or 1280×960 or 1920x1200 

 

 

Signed postcard

$15 pledges receive this signed project postcard sent from me to you:

(17x12cm or 6.7x4.70 inches)

 

 

 

T-Shirt Black Will-o’-the-Tits (S, M, L, XL)

$45 pledges receive a T-Shirt with the logo of the Project.

 

 

Paintings Ink

$200 pledges receive one of the four unique and original hand made paintings signed.  Ink on paper. 50x70cm.

You can choose from:

Psycological portrait 1

 

 

 psycological portrait 2 (NOT AVAILABLE ANYMORE)

 

 psycological portrait 3 (NOT AVAILABLE ANYMORE)

 

 

 psycological portrait 4

 

Design (70x50 cm)

 

 

P.G. (70x50 cm)

 

 

 

Palazzo Caetani 70x50 cm
story_txt:
29/07/2013
 
Finally I can show you the first shoots of the Wonderwall!!!
 

 

 

 

 
Photographers: Enrico Odano and Paolo Inselvini
Site www.io-studio.it
 
27/05/2013 Hello everybody, I want to truly thank everybody who helped me and believed in me. For me your support has been very important. The project was a success. Now I will have to work a lot, it will be done with a big smile and a great awareness: I can and I want to continue to pursue the path of art.

Ciao a tutti,  Voglio sinceramente ringraziare tutti quelli che mi hanno aiutato e hanno creduto in me. Per me è stato davvero importante. Il progetto è stato un successo. Ora ci sarà tanto tanto da lavorare, verrà fatto con un grande sorriso e una grande consapevolezza: posso e voglio continuare a percorrere la strada dell'arte.

story:
YCS campaign and our vision:

YouthCanSlam (YCS) is a spoken word festival that will be held for the first time in Ottawa   this August of 2013.  Its focus is to fill a cultural void by providing a national stage for youth spoken word artists across Canada to demonstrate poetry at its finest in a five day celebration and competition of the Spoken Word Poetry art form. The Festival Organizing Committee consists of some of Canada's most dedicated and decorated artists. They pledge to bring to Ottawa an event that will not only be memorable, but one that will become a mainstay for the showcasing of Canada's talented youth. Contributions for this landmark event will not only help build a festival that will rival other spoken word festivals across Canada, mainly the Canadian Individual Poetry Slam and the Canadian Festival of Spoken Word, but also heighten awareness of one of the fastest growing art forms while heightening the appeal of the nation’s capital as not only a government city but as a city that is known for its thriving art community.

We're in this together!

YCS has set our goal to $3500. This number is small for an art festival and you may be thinking, "How can a five day festival run on such small funds?" The reality is, given that we are in our first year, we are planning to start with a reasonable goal and not have to build a five day event around unrealistic expectations.  So we put our goals in arms reach, one that we believe can be accomplished; but not without your generosity! It is with your contribution that we will be able to:

  • Book venues for daily poetry competitions and workshops
  • Book artists to facilitate workshops
  • Make down payments on renting sound equipment and lodging for travelling artists
  • Purchase awards, pay for sub-contracting professionals involved in the production process of the festival, and have additional monies to cover any emergency costs or necessary expenses such as purchasing of licenses, registration and administration fees and food and beverage costs for hired artists.

But that's not it!

YSC will give back to you! Your contributions will get you feeling the poetic rush as we offer you perks that you just can't say no to. From discounted event tickets, to poetry memorabilia, we have something for the art lover in everybody, and once our campaign is over; if we have not reached our goal we will be applying your generous contributions to manage our base costs for the festival such as venue booking and artist fees.

Where do we go from here?

We grow. Like any festival or event organized for the purpose of bridging communities through the arts, we desire to make this first time event one that puts the talent of our youth across Canada on the map.  For the last 12 years spoken word poetry has gained so much momentum that to not offer a platform for our youth would be a disservice to our national art community. While Spoken Word may unofficially be the fastest growing art form, it is officially the most underrated and underfunded. We hope that spotlighting young poets who are stepping up to claim their space in the rich art legacy that our country has to offer will create avenues that do not presently exist for spoken word poets to professionalize themselves as career artists.   

It's not just about the funds!

If you find yourself in a position where you want to help YCS but can't donate, here are other ways to help support our campaign:

SPREAD THE WORD-Use any and all of your social network forums to help promote our campaign, you could post our picture on your profiles, tweet our website, share our campaign link, and even volunteer!

CONNECT WITH US-If you have any interest in supporting YCS as a volunteer, have any professional connections you can introduce us to or just have ideas and suggestions you would like to share we would love to hear them. You can reach us at youthcanslam@gmail.com.

story:
THE LIFE CUBE COMES TO DOWNTOWN LAS VEGAS

We are SO excited to create a Life Cube installation for Downtown Las Vegas in February/March 2014. The success of The Life Cube – Art at Burning Man over the last four years could not have happened without the hundreds of supporters, contributors, volunteers, and an ever-growing community of “Cube-ists”. 

WHERE IT ALL BEGAN

I believe if you write down what you want to accomplish in your life - your goals, dreams, wishes, and aspirations, the chance of it happening increases significantly.  I've been doing it myself and it works!  

In August 2013, I wrote down a wish to create a Life Cube in a city or museum around the world.  And here we are now, building in the middle of Downtown Las Vegas!  We are incredibly lucky to have this opportunity, and even more fortunate to have the skills, talent and dedication of a great local team working together to make it happen. 

OUR DUAL MISSION: 

1) Connecting art with community; and

2) Encouraging people to write down their goals, dreams, wishes, and aspirations.

Creating our first urban installation for the Life Cube Project is a big step and a pivotal moment. We're building now on an entire city block in the East Freemont District of Downtown Las Vegas, and in addition to the Downtown Project, we are partnering with as many local artists, volunteers, and members of the community as possible. As with each progression of The Life Cube, there’s a new level of interactivity and engagement, including dramatic lighting displays at night, giant murals painted by local artists during public viewing hours, a tapestry wall composed of hundreds of individually painted panels crafted into a huge mosaic, a photo gallery of the downtown Las Vegas scene past and present, and musical performances featured on selected nights.   

Stay tuned… more news to come!

                 

WHAT'S NEW 

The Downtown Las Vegas Life Cube Project features two new and very exciting elements, including outreach to area schools, promoting artistic participation by local kids, and raising awareness about the importance of goal-setting, even at an early age.  In addition, we're building "satellite Cubes" to be decorated by local artists and installed at area shops, businesses, pubs and restaurants for the duration of month-long Life Cube display.  All will be gathered together at the end to burn in the 24-foot high primary Cube on the lot at Fremont and 9th Ave, across from Atomic Liquors.

SENDING  GOALS & WISHES SKYWARD IN A BLAZE OF GLORY

As before, we'll distribute "wish-sticks" for writing down goals, dreams and ambitions, and the interactive design will provide slots for depositing each of thousands of wishes into the Cube.  A final, fiery event on Friday, March 21st (3/21 Burn!) will welcome everyone back as we burn the Cube and send all of those wishes into the universe.

           

HELP MAKE OUR DREAMS COME TRUE!

Whether you give $1 or $1000, please consider a donation. Every little bit helps, and every donor gets a wish. If you're here in Las Vegas or supporting The Life Cube from afar, we're glad to have you with us!

We're delighted to be bringing The Life Cube Project to Downtown Las Vegas, and are grateful for community funding from the Downtown Project and other sources that help make it happen.

Our IndieGoGo campaign: We're raising just $15,000 more to bring this installation to the location, build it with a team of volunteers, pay for municipal permits, fire safety and police protection, enable local artists to be involved with free supplies and materials, outreach to Las Vegas schoolchildren, bringing busloads to the Cube and satellite Cubes out to their schools, host area musicians performing at the Cube, print wish sticks and our photo archive display, design and set up brilliant night-time lighting and create an awesome final Burn ceremony on March 21st.  

Your donation, combined with hundreds of others, will enable us to reach our goal and fund it all! 

Every donor gets a wish! There is other stuff you get (see rewards!) -- but most of all, whether small or large,  you will know that your donation really does support this art project and its message.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

We hope you'll contribute, but that's not the only way to help the Life Cube Project Las Vegas!

  • If you're in the Las Vegas area, or know someone who is, we LOVE volunteers! Sign up on the Volunteer page at our website: www.lifecubeproject.com/volunteer
  • Like us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/TheLifeCube

Your support means more than you know!  We're glad to have you with us.

If you're in the Las Vegas area, or know someone who is, we LOVE volunteers! Sign up on the Volunteer page at our website: www.lifecubeproject.com/volunteer

Like us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/TheLifeCube



Your support means more than you know!  We're glad to have you with us.

story:
Dear Family and Friends,

I write to you today with an exciting opportunity for you to be involved in helping me further my artistic career! As you may know, after returning to school at the age of 50, I surmounted health issues and made many sacrifices that allowed me to successfully earn a Bachelor of Science degree in Urban Arts at Coppin State University with a 3.905 GPA.

 I applied to the Vermont Studio Center’s residency program and was accepted! This program is an extremely competitive and prestigious residency for artists and writers across the nation and the world.The residency, located in Johnson, Vermont, is the largest international artists' and writers' residency program in the United States. I have not only been accepted but also received a partial scholarship!

Although I have received this fellowship, I am still in need of $3,000 to pay additional expenses including, but not limited to: the remainder of the residency tuition, round trip train fare and supplies. For this I need your help. As a Community Arts Teacher, Art Activist, and Art Multigenerational Specialist with experience teaching people with disabilities, I serve my community through bringing the joy of clay. 

Pursuing my own artistic practice in a professional studio setting is necessary to be the best Community Artist I can be in order to have the greatest impact on the communities that I work with. As an artist and life-long learner, I will be immersed in the midst of a diverse artist population in a nurturing learning environment that is designed to allow artists to focus solely on creating art and acquiring new skills. The residency in Vermont will put me in contact with artists from all over the world. I will bring this experience back to Baltimore: to my students, fellow artists, teachers and organizations, advancing the creativity and artistic practice of those I work with.

I ask you today to please consider donating any amount to encourage and enable me to go to Vermont this spring. You can contribute in a number of ways; If you are able to give $25 to $50, you will receive a card with one of my small linoleum prints on it, $51-$84 you will receive a handmade ceramic pendant necklace, $85 to $149 will receive a monotype from the Virgin Series. $150 and up you will receive one of the Golden Lady Series figures! I appreciate any and all contributions. Thank you for your time and consideration. Do not hesitate to contact me should you have any questions about this residency.

Please see my work by clicking on the "Gallery" tab above this letter.

Peace and pottery,

Sallah
story_txt: Dear Family and Friends,I write to you today with an exciting opportunity for you to be involved in helping me further my artistic career! As you may know, after returning to school at the age of 50, I surmounted health issues and made many sacrifices that allowed me to successfully earn a Bachelor of Science degree in Urban Arts at Coppin State University with a 3.905 GPA. I applied to the Vermont Studio Center’s residency program and was accepted! This program is an extremely competitive and prestigious residency for artists and writers across the nation and the world.The residency, located in Johnson, Vermont, is the largest international artists' and writers' residency program in the United States. I have not only been accepted but also received a partial scholarship! Although I have received this fellowship, I am still in need of $3,000 to pay additional expenses including, but not limited to: the remainder of the residency tuition, round trip train fare and supplies. For this I need your help. As a Community Arts Teacher, Art Activist, and Art Multigenerational Specialist with experience teaching people with disabilities, I serve my community through bringing the joy of clay. Pursuing my own artistic practice in a professional studio setting is necessary to be the best Community Artist I can be in order to have the greatest impact on the communities that I work with. As an artist and life-long learner, I will be immersed in the midst of a diverse artist population in a nurturing learning environment that is designed to allow artists to focus solely on creating art and acquiring new skills. The residency in Vermont will put me in contact with artists from all over the world. I will bring this experience back to Baltimore: to my students, fellow artists, teachers and organizations, advancing the creativity and artistic practice of those I work with.I ask you today to please consider donating any amount to encourage and enable me to go to Vermont this spring. You can contribute in a number of ways; If you are able to give $25 to $50, you will receive a card with one of my small linoleum prints on it, $51-$84 you will receive a handmade ceramic pendant necklace, $85 to $149 will receive a monotype from the Virgin Series. $150 and up you will receive one of the Golden Lady Series figures! I appreciate any and all contributions. Thank you for your time and consideration. Do not hesitate to contact me should you have any questions about this residency.Please see my work by clicking on the "Gallery" tab above this letter.Peace and pottery,Sallah

story:
In French at the bottom of the page. Website GeOptimiste.com

Curiosity, Authenticity, Generosity 

Social TV looking for the unusual, the wacky, the amazing. An Optimistic Look at our world and local talents. The quest for Living Treasures.

Geoptimiste.com is a participatory audiovisual card. Geography of the talents and shared emotions.

Meet between "Local" and "Geeks" 

  1. The ambition is to create a global Social TV made it ​​A to Z by the public itself. 
  2. The aim is to promote the encounter between a territory's "local talents"  and the "tourists" who travel to meet them.
  3. The procedure is the introduction of "VideoDeals" and their publication on geoptimiste.com
  4. The result is an offer Geo-certified "local talent" available on all screens (TV, computer, tablet, smartphone, Carplay, etc..)

Geography of emotion! 

The "local" present his "talent" sur Geoptimiste.com. It propose a "videodeal" : A promotion for the geek against an audiovisual "Pitch" publié sur geoptimiste.com.


The "geek" (traveller, tourist) accepts the "deal" sur Geoptimiste.com.

The "geek" can book a appointment on line for an authentic, cheap and friendly moment.


The "local" can make ends and be promote by social media !

Geoptimiste.com reaches and publishes the emotion by a participatory mapping.

GeOptimist.com verify the submission. If it is consistent, "VideoDeal" is found. The "Local" gift that was waiting is then paid to the "Geek". The "visual pitch" is GéO-Positioned, GéO-Certified, GéO-Categorized (gastronomy, art, sport, recreation, crafts, etc..).

The "visual pitch" is available in the application GeOptimiste.com Youtube, Vimeo, etc.. From your smartphone, tablet, GPS, computer, Apple TV, etc..


The offer is available around me. It is no longer necessary to search in multiple guides. I have lots of proposals in hand.

I have juste to choose and to go guided by my GPS. i am surrounded by a world of talent and emotion.

What will the money? 

The real start of GeOptimiste.com will begin in France, 16 June 2014 by a communication action. Everyone knows the "Tour de France". "Francois Singer" drives ​​the first "Tour de France" in a electric car. This is an opportunity to mobilize "tourist offices", "the regional daily press", "radio stations and local TV." :

- More than 100 cities steps 

- 1000 "geeks" learn to report TV

- More than 10,000 "videodeals" made

The money will fund the first 112 days planned for this trip: 110 training meeting "geek" learn to report TV. 11 162 KM. Accommodation 112 days and travel expenses. And especially the publication of the first ten thousand talents of France:

• Meeting of training of GeOptimistes "geek" - "Charter GeOptimiste" (from 16 years in France).

• Brainstorming meetings : who are "the talents" here ?  tourist offices, competition in local newspapers, etc.

• Electric car equipped and suitable : solar panels and subjective camera , GPS, 4G connections . Possibility of live interventions.

• Audiovisual equipment shooting and mobile Postproduction: iPad latest generation iPhone last generation, Go Pro , Geonaute 360° , Mac Book, etc. .

• Back- Office : Reception reports " geeks " , verification and formatting. Initiation and evolution of iOS and Android applications.

• Establishment of the mapping system.

• Miscellaneous costs , insurance, etc. .

The unused funds may serve as a basis for further development of the program. The first Tour de France in electric car will be an incentive by example.

It will serve as reference for the gradual establishment - from October 2014 and 2015 , other destinations (Italy , Spain , USA , Brazil , Argentina , England, Deutschland, etc. . ) .


Why France first? 

France is the most visited country in the world. The variety of opportunities, diversity of activities, the tourist offer are very important ... 

And François Singer is French. But above all, with his accomplice eternal Thierry Naud (Ushuaia - Des racines et des Ailes - Thalassa) he made ​​no less than "20 Tours de France." They flew "their country" helicopter for aerial photography. They walked to horse and carriage ... This is not to say they like it. They have intimate carnal knowledge. They will share it.

"The "geek" visits a strange place and eats a typical specialty. He practices an unexpected activity and he adapts... 

But he disappears. Because he is here for you. he puts you in tune "as if you were there." he does films in "subjective camera" (Google Glass - Go-RO) and short times, denser. 

By clicking on the "local sites" everyone receives every day on smartphones, tablets, monitors: the emotion of the travel.

This is a new script, a new audiovisual narrative to which I invite you "

Yes everyone can travel with Geoptimiste.com. Ready for a trip around the world in your hand?


About the team

Francois Singer Creator


20 rounds of France. Whether for the Association of the Most Beautiful Villages of France, Holiday Villages for families, for the National Union of Tourism Associations, Vacances Bleues, Vacanciel, the works council of the SNCF, Holidays Auvergne Limousin, Renewal, the UCPA, the Ministry of Tourism, the European year of social tourism, etc.. Whether for Radio France or aerial photography for FSP: I flew to France to Bonifacio Riquewhir, skirted its shores of Dunkirk in Irun, sailed along its coast from Collioure to Menton. I have grown in the Dordogne and in Daguin Auch. I drank a Cognac and Armagnac can not reverse. I stayed at Tamié and the abbey of Mont Saint-Michel (more frugal). I had insomnia in Relais Chateaux and myself dozing camping blue waves. On foot, on horseback and by car, canoe, ULM, winter and summer ... I can say that I love my country.


Thierry Naud Director

 

47 countries visited : 27 years of experience for the most prestigious television service of Geography and the planet: Ushuaia (Nicolas Hulot), Vu du Ciel, Roots and Wings, Another World, Fugget, Thalassa, etc..


Christophe Van Hamme Realistic

I am an entrepreneur and international financial profile. I focus on the
organizational aspects, structuring, the business in which I believe. 
GéOptimiste.com offers an innovative collaborative model which I hope to contribute with my experience.


 GeOptimiste.com/fr

Curiosité, Authenticité, Générosité

Une sociale TV en quête de l'insolite, du farfelu, du beau. Un regard Optimiste sur notre monde et les talents locaux. La quête des Trésors Vivants.

Géoptimiste.com est une carte audiovisuelle participative. Une géographie des talents et des émotions partagées. 


La rencontre des "Terroirs" et des "Geeks" :


  1. L'ambition est de créer une Sociale TV mondiale faite de A à Z par le public lui-même.
  2. Le but est de promouvoir la rencontre entre les "talents locaux" d'un territoire et les "touristes" qui voyagent à leur rencontre.
  3. Le mode opératoire est la création, dans chaque pays du portail geoptimiste.com/pays et des "VideoDeals".
  4. Le résultat est une cartographie audiovisuelle de l'offre "talents locaux" disponible sur tous nos écrans (TV, Ordinateur, Tablette, Smartphone, Carplay,etc.). Des GPS de l'émotion.

Une géographie de l'émotion !

Sur GeOptimiste.com, c'est le "terroir" lui même qui donne rendez-vous via les réseaux sociaux, internet et sous la forme de points GPS. Sollicité, invité, le "geek" bénéficie d'une remise, d'une promotion, d'un cadeau.  

Sur GeOptimiste.com, le "Geek" accepte le "VidéoDeal". En échange il doit filmer "en caméra subjective" la rencontre. Il s'engage à respecter la méthodologie mise au point par "François Singer". Il fait le montage conformément au cahier des charges GeOptimiste.com (durée, qualité, Timeline imposée, etc.). Il soumet le "Pitch Audiovisuel" à GeOptimiste.com.

GeOptimiste vérifie la soumission. Si elle est conforme, le "VideoDeal" est constaté. Le cadeau "Terroir" qui était en attente est alors versé au "Geek". Le "pitch audiovisuel" est GéO Positionné, GéO Certifié, GéO Catégorisé (gastronomie, art, sport, loisir, artisanat, etc.).

Le "pitch audiovisuel" est consultable dans l'application GeOptimiste.com sur Youtube, Vimeo, etc. Depuis votre smartphone, tablette, GPS, ordinateur, Apple TV, etc.

L'offre précède la demande. Il n'est plus nécessaire de chercher dans de multiples guides. Le "touriste" a dans sa main des propositions de rencontre. il n'a plus qu'à choisir de visu et à se laisser guider par son GPS. Il est au coeur d'un monde de talents et d'émotion. 


À quoi servira l'argent ?


La mise en route de GeOptimiste.com commencera en France, le 8 juin 2014 (au lendemain de la finale de Roland Garros) par une action de communication. Tout le monde connait "le Tour de France". "Francois Singer" va effectué le premier "Tour de France" en voiture électrique. Ce sera l'occasion de mobiliser "les offices de tourisme", "la presse quotidienne régionale", "les stations de radio et TV locales". 

L'argent servira à financer les 112 premiers jours prévus pour ce périple : 110 rencontres formation "geek". 11 162 KM . Hébergement sur 112 jours et location de salles au fur et à mesure de la tournée et surtout publication des 10000 talents de France: 

•Pour les "formations des GeOptimistes geek volontaires" au tournage vidéo charte GeOptimiste (dès 16 ans en France).

•Pour les "réunions d'information et de Brain Storming" dans les offices de tourisme.

•Voiture électrique équipée et adaptée : caméra subjective et panneaux solaires, GPS, liaisons 4G. Possibilité d'interventions live.

•Équipements audiovisuels de prises de vue et de Postproduction mobiles : iPad dernière génération, iPhone dernière génération, Go Pro, GeOnaute 360°, Mac Book, etc.

•Back-Office : Réceptions des reportages "geeks", vérification et mise en forme. Mise en route et évolution des applications IOS et Android. 

•Mise en place du système de cartographie.

•Frais divers, assurances, etc.

Les fonds éventuellement non utilisés serviront de base de développement pour la suite du programme de développement. Le premier tour de France en voiture électrique sera une incitation par l'exemple. 

Il servira de référence pour la mise en place progressive - à partir d'octobre 2014 et en 2015, des autres destinations (Italy, Spain, USA, Brazil, Argentina, England, Deutschland, etc.). 


Pourquoi la France en premier ?

La France est le pays le plus visité au monde. La variété des possibilités, la diversité des activités, l'offre touristique y sont très importantes... 

Et puis, François Singer est français. Mais surtout, avec son éternel complice Thierry Naud (Ushuaia - Des racines et des ailes - Thalassa) il a effectué pas moins de "20 Tours de France". Ils ont survolé "leur pays" en hélicoptère pour les prises de vue aériennes. Ils l'ont parcouru à pied à cheval et en voiture... C'est peu de dire qu'ils l'aiment. Ils en ont une connaissance intime, charnelle. Ils vont la partager. 

Francois Singer : "Je suis hébergé dans un lieu insolite, je déjeune une spécialité typique. Je pratique une activité inattendue. Je m'adapte et vie toutes les aventures. 

Mais, je disparais. Car je suis là pour vous. Je vous mets en prise directe : "comme si vous y étiez". Je ne filme qu'en caméra subjective (Google Glass - Go-RO) et des moments courts, denses.

Ainsi en cliquant sur les "pitchs locaux" que vous recevez chaque jour sur vos smartphones, tablettes, écrans : C'est vous qui voyagez, rencontrez et ressentez l'émotion.

C'est une nouvelle écriture, une nouvelle narration audiovisuelle à laquelle je vous invite"

Oui, c'est vous qui voyagez. GeOptimiste.com est un media. Le vôtre. Jusqu'où irons-nous ensemble ? Prêt pour un tour du monde dans votre main ?


Hello Startup: Orange&BFM.TV



Gen Tek : OUATCH.tv



Comment nous aider et être utile aux talents de votre ville ou de votre région ? Comment participer à l'émission de télévision mondiale faite par le public lui-même ?

Vous n'avez qu'à créer ou rejoindre un collectif Meetup. Vous vous engagez à respecter la Meetup's Community Guidelines. Vous devez nommer vos membres "GeOptimistes". Vous envoyez un mail à contact@geoptimiste.com pour recevoir le Kit "GeOptimiste logos". Vous faites grandir votre groupe en commencant par un premier événement chez vous ou dans un bar de la ville. Vous échangez vos idées et vous vous tenez prêt. Un GeOptimiste oeuvre pour le partage d'émotion entre les generations, les continents, les cultures, les régions, le terroir et les geeks. Il créé des "VideoDeals" des "pitchs audiovisuel de l'émotion locale".


À propos de l'équipe ?

Francois Singer le Créateur


20 tours de France.
Que ce soit pour l’Association des Plus Beaux Villages de France, pour
Villages Vacances Familles, pour l’Union National des Associations de
ourisme, Vacances Bleues, Vacanciel, le comité d’entreprise de la SNCF,
Vacances Auvergne Limousin, Renouveau, l’UCPA, le ministère du
Tourisme, l'année européenne du tourisme social, etc.
Que ce soit pour Radio France ou des prises de vues aériennes pour la FSP :
J’ai survolé la France de Bonifaccio à Riquewhir, longé son littoral de
Dunkerque à Irun, navigué sur ses côtes de Collioure à Menton. J’ai grossi
en Dordogne et chez Daguin à Auch. J’ai bu un Armagnac à Cognac et peut être pas l’inverse. J’ai logé à Tamié et dans l’abbaye du Mont Saint-Michel (plus frugal). J’ai eu des insomnies dans des Relais Châteaux et me suis assoupi au
camping des flots bleus. À pied, à cheval et en voiture, en canoë, en ULM, en hiver et en été…
C’est peu de dire que j’aime mon pays.


Thierry Naud le Réalisateur

 

47 pays visités. 27 années d'expérience pour les plus prestigieuses émissions de télévision au service de la Géographie et de la planète :

Ushuaïa (Nicolas Hulot), Vu du Ciel, Des racines et des Ailes, Un autre Monde, Faut pas rêver, Thalassa, etc.


Christophe Van Hamme le Réaliste

Je suis un entrepreneur au profil financier et international (Brésil, France, Israël, Allemagne, etc). Je m'attache aux aspects organisationnels structurants des business dans lesquels je crois. Le GéOptimiste propose un modèle collaboratif innovant à très fort potentiel. J'espère pouvoir y contribuer avec mon expérience.

Ils ont survolé "leur pays" en hélicoptère pour les prises de vue aériennes. Ils l'ont parcouru à pied à cheval et en voiture... C'est peu de dire qu'ils l'aiment. Ils en ont une connaissance intime, charnelle. Ils vont la partager. Francois Singer : "Je suis hébergé dans un lieu insolite, je déjeune une spécialité typique. Je pratique une activité inattendue. Je m'adapte et vie toutes les aventures. Mais, je disparais. Car je suis là pour vous. Je vous mets en prise directe : "comme si vous y étiez". Je ne filme qu'en caméra subjective (Google Glass - Go-RO) et des moments courts, denses.Ainsi en cliquant sur les "pitchs locaux" que vous recevez chaque jour sur vos smartphones, tablettes, écrans : C'est vous qui voyagez, rencontrez et ressentez l'émotion.C'est une nouvelle écriture, une nouvelle narration audiovisuelle à laquelle je vous invite"Oui, c'est vous qui voyagez. GeOptimiste.com est un media. Le vôtre. Jusqu'où irons-nous ensemble ? Prêt pour un tour du monde dans votre main ?Hello Startup: Orange&BFM.TVGen Tek : OUATCH.tvComment nous aider et être utile aux talents de votre ville ou de votre région ? Comment participer à l'émission de télévision mondiale faite par le public lui-même ?Vous n'avez qu'à créer ou rejoindre un collectif Meetup. Vous vous engagez à respecter la Meetup's Community Guidelines. Vous devez nommer vos membres "GeOptimistes". Vous envoyez un mail à contact@geoptimiste.com pour recevoir le Kit "GeOptimiste logos". Vous faites grandir votre groupe en commencant par un premier événement chez vous ou dans un bar de la ville. Vous échangez vos idées et vous vous tenez prêt. Un GeOptimiste oeuvre pour le partage d'émotion entre les generations, les continents, les cultures, les régions, le terroir et les geeks. Il créé des "VideoDeals" des "pitchs audiovisuel de l'émotion locale".À propos de l'équipe ?Francois Singer le Créateur
20 tours de France.Que ce soit pour l’Association des Plus Beaux Villages de France, pourVillages Vacances Familles, pour l’Union National des Associations de ourisme, Vacances Bleues, Vacanciel, le comité d’entreprise de la SNCF,Vacances Auvergne Limousin, Renouveau, l’UCPA, le ministère du 
Tourisme, l'année européenne du tourisme social, etc.Que ce soit pour Radio France ou des prises de vues aériennes pour la FSP :J’ai survolé la France de Bonifaccio à Riquewhir, longé son littoral deDunkerque à Irun, navigué sur ses côtes de Collioure à Menton. J’ai grossien Dordogne et chez Daguin à Auch. J’ai bu un Armagnac à Cognac et peut être pas l’inverse. J’ai logé à Tamié et dans l’abbaye du Mont Saint-Michel (plus frugal). J’ai eu des insomnies dans des Relais Châteaux et me suis assoupi aucamping des flots bleus. À pied, à cheval et en voiture, en canoë, en ULM, en hiver et en été…C’est peu de dire que j’aime mon pays.Thierry Naud le Réalisateur 47 pays visités. 27 années d'expérience pour les plus prestigieuses émissions de télévision au service de la Géographie et de la planète :Ushuaïa (Nicolas Hulot), Vu du Ciel, Des racines et des Ailes, Un autre Monde, Faut pas rêver, Thalassa, etc.Christophe Van Hamme le Réaliste
Je suis un entrepreneur au profil financier et international (Brésil, France, Israël, Allemagne, etc). Je m'attache aux aspects organisationnels structurants des business dans lesquels je crois. Le GéOptimiste propose un modèle collaboratif innovant à très fort potentiel. J'espère pouvoir y contribuer avec mon expérience.

story:
Short Summary

Hello, my name is Nikiah Potts and I am a 16 year old special effects makeup artist. I have been in the Haunted Attraction Industry for 3 years, and am on my way to the 4th. I started my own company called Fearwithin Special Effects Makeup. I have been passionate about makeup for 3 years and hope to do it full time one day. Currently, i am working with basic supplies that most artists consider to be beginners tools. I would like to change that, but i don't have the money to build my kit up to what I would like it to be. Unfortunately, i have done just about everything that I can with the supplies that I currently have in my kit. I want to further expand my skill set and keep practicing what i love to do, so that it will allow for more oppurtunities for me in the makeup industry. Special Effects Makeup is expensive, but is pretty much a one time investment. So, once i raise the money i need i will be able to learn more and expand my level of skill. 

What We Need & What You Get

I need any help that I can get. The optimal amount would be the $1,250 because that would allow me to buy everything i need to really start learning everything about this wonderful art form. The money is going towards an airbrush makeup system, airbrush makeup, alcohol activated makeup, and materials to begin sculpting and making professional masks and prosthetic appliances. 

 

When you contribute money, there are incentives. 

See "Perks" below to see what your money can get you besides one extremely happy artist.

The Impact

Special Effects Makeup is my life. It means the world to me, but i just don't have the money to continue doing more advanced makeups. The littlest amount of money will help me out. I just want to be able to express myself creatively and start planning for my career. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, share my project and help me get the word out about my makeup! 

Check out my website! 

http://fearwithinsfx.weebly.com/

 

Thank you all so much!

story:
Short Summary

Bungalow55 is a community based collaboration centre with a strong youth focus that addresses the need of safe space for rural youth. One of the youth programs that calls the bungalow home is the Progressive Youth Initiative (PYI), a dynamic drop in program, where youth gather, create art, collaborate on ideas together, and learn about social enterprise and social engagement. The PYI have been meeting regularly for over a year with the assistance of a grant. The grant is about to run out and the PYI would like to continue supporting local youth. You can support the youth in our community so that they can continue to have their own safe space, where so many positive things happen.

The above video was created by one of the youth involved in the PYI. It is a youth perspective on the spaces at bungalow55. The pictures were taken at the first ever PYI event, a youth jamboree. The Jamboree took place throughout the community and invited all members, not just youth, to participate in creative, community building activities. Community members were invited to create a collaborative graffiti wall, use paint filled balloons to create a interactive art piece and use litter as material for an art mosaic. 

What We Need

For the youth program to continue they need community support to cover their rental costs. In order to cover one years rent for the program we need community support in sponsoring 30 youth memberships for bungalow55 at $50 each. 

The Impact

Currently in Elora, Ontario there is no space for youth (thirteen and up) to gather after school hours. Safe space provides opportunity for youth to socialize, to build skills, and to become active citizens. This is what happens through the Progressive Youth Initiative and Bungalow55.

story:
What is the Euroboks?

 The Euroboks is our solution to the lack of diversity and options available in the current shelving and wall decor market. Its sleek ergonomic design adds drama and functionality to any home.

  • Stylish, sleek, and fits into any home decor:
  • Modern
  • Eclectic
  • Classic
  • Fun to arrange variations

The crown molding shape gradually tapers to your wall while providing enough depth to prominently display your favorite items. 

Perfect for any room in your house, the variety of finishes and sizes will add endless possibilities to any space you put them in. Most shelving, shadowboxes, frames, and other wall décor are mass produced overseas and have sloppy craftmanship.

The Euroboks is high quality, seamless, and pragmatic. Whether you're an interior designer or just want to add some flare to your home, the Euroboks was made for you!

What the problem is:

So far we've been producing these by hand. It's extremely labor intensive and time consuming. It takes roughly 4 hours to create one perfectly by hand. With your help we can get the mold needed to make these out of polyurethane.

Making one by hand involves:  
  • finding perfect material;
  • straight pieces of molding with no knots
  • finding strong adhesives
  • making perfect cuts
  • perfectly aligning pieces while adhesive sets
  • sanding
  • staining
  • clear coating
  • reworking each piece to perfection
  • respray + drying
  • On top of all of this, the tool and insurance costs raise this to even higher amounts!

^Four or more hours^

Making one with a mold:

  • Making a master copy of the mold
  • Injecting the right density of urethane
  • light finishing

^All done within 30-45 minutes!^


The two pictures below show the difference between handcrafted and mold created. To a highly trained eye, the two are identical in look, feel, and quality

We had a few samples made from a local manufacturer and are thrilled with the results!

The funding we receive will go to making molds so that we can produce on a larger scale. Each mold is ~$750.
With your help we'll be able to begin producing this faster, more efficiently, and in higher quality than ever before. We'll also be able to offer our custom fossilized coral finish!

The Perks!

Here is a picture of the various perks we're offering! We also have t-shirts and our foot campaign handouts as alternative perks.

The result of your support

Your contribution will make all the difference! We will finally be able to produce and get this product to more people like YOU. Artists, decorators, and general home decor enthusiasts will appreciate this unique decor item.

How it came to be

While doing crown molding installation Wilkinson would bring home left over molding from jobs for fun weekend projects with his children and their friends. A master craftsman and inventor, the idea for these came about while he was demonstrating how two edges could be put together with no seam showing. He saw an opportunity to create a unique item that would highlight a knick knack while adding an entirely new way of decorating any room. Over eight years ago he began this journey and created these by hand for close friends and family.

We'd be grateful for your help!

Check us out on facebook , twitter , and our website Euroboks . We're working on developing an Etsy seller's page for handcrafted items, and are available for custom work. Let us know what you think and thank you for taking the time to look at our page!

story:
If you missed the cut-off to donate, but still want to contribute, please visit www.indiegogo.com/onemillionstrongandyou.

About One Million Strong:

We are on a mission to raise $10,000 to fund the 2012-2016 One Million Strong Traveling Photo Essay Exhibit, which kicks off at the Hayti Heritage Center in Durham, North Carolina on October 2 and closes on November 30.

The One Million Strong Photo Essay Exhibit captures the essence of the Million Man March (Washington, D.C.) and the 10 years of subsequent political/cultural gatherings it inspired: The World Day of Atonement in New York City (1996); The Million Women March in Philadelphia (1997); The Million Youth March in Harlem (1998); The Million Youth Movement in Atlanta (1998); The Million Family March in Washington, DC. (2000); and the Millions More Movement March in Washington, DC (2005).

The One Million Strong Exhibit consists of one hundred 16" x 20" and 11" x 14" photos, text, and video, and caters to community and educational groups. This will be the first full-showing of the collected work and will become a traveling exhibit, available to schools, community centers, and museums.

In addition to private viewings for school and community groups, we are organizing 5 separate programs to bring people to the exhibit. This programming will serve as the template for programming at future exhibits.

• The Opening Ceremony Featuring a Q&A with Photographer Katina Parker on Oct. 2

• Long Live the Spirit - A Panel Discussion on the Million Man March on Oct. 16. Panelists include Dr. Mark Anthony Neal (Professor of Black Popular Culture in the Department of African and African-American Studies at Duke University); Filmmaker/Photographer Katina Parker(who documented the Million Man, Million Women, and Million Youth Marches); Min. Amon Muhammad (a Durham-based minister in the Nation of Islam who helped to organize the Million Man March) and Omisade Burney-Scott (an activist consultant and mother of two boys, who supported the Million Man March). The panel will be moderated by the Rev. Carl Kenney (a faith leader, cultural commentator, and an award-winning columnist who attended the Million Man March).

• The People United Part I - A Pre-Election Townhall Meeting on Oct. 30 (panelists TBA in October 2012)

• The People United Part II - A Post-Election Strategy Session on Nov. 13 (panelists TBA in October 2012)

• And CATCH THE FIRE: A Night of Conscious Poetry and Song on Nov. 27 featuring Dasan Ahanu, Justin Thomas Robinson, Collective Sun, Rachael Derello, Faith Holsaert & Laila Nur. Additional performers TBA in October 2012.

Installations of this work have previously been shown at the North Carolina Museum of History (Raleigh, NC), the International Center & Civil Rights Museum (Greensboro, NC), Delta Fine Arts Center (Winston-Salem, NC), and Lucy Florence Coffee House (Los Angeles, CA).

You may view images here: http://www.facebook.com/onemillionstrong.

Your Donation Pays for...

• Honorariums, catering, and personnel fees for programs at the 2012 Hayti Heritage exhibit, including the Opening Ceremony on Oct. 2, the 17-year anniversary of the Million Man March panel discussion on Oct. 16, the pre-election strategy townhall meeting on Oct. 30, the post-election strategy town hall meeting on Nov. 13, and the Closing Ceremony on Nov. 27.

• Hand development of over 40 rolls of film that have been sitting in my refrigerator for 6+ years.

• Printing contact sheets for almost 100 rolls of film.

• Making 100+ tests and final prints for the exhibition.

• Custom-framing.

• Photo lab and equipment rental.

• Color film processing fees.

• Researching/fact-checking the essay text.

• Researching/editing exhibition video(s).

• Time to focus on creating/continuing this work.

• A moderate budget for newspaper and web ads.

One Million Strong is Being Used to:

• Celebrate and affirm images of Black people who have engaged in political protest for the betterment of their families and communities.

• Foster critical dialogue about the diversity of political perspectives that exist in Black communities and develop methods to work across our differences.

• Inspire participants (youth in particular) to document their communities.

• Engage, activate, and organize poor people around pressing issues that continue to threaten the health of our families like the prison industrial complex, youth violence, housing, education, and unemployment. 

Other Ways You Can Help:

• Get your friends & family to donate.

• Like One Million Strong on Facebook.

• Tweet about One Million Strong. Direct your Tweets @KatinaParker.

• Host an exhibition (for community, academic, and museum spaces only) by emailing onemillionstrong95@gmail.com.

• Book Katina Parker to speak about One Million Strong at your school, church, or museum by emailing onemillionstrong95@gmail.com.

story:
Short Summary

Larime Taylor is a disabled mouth artist living in California. Life on $750 a month from Social Security isn’t easy, so he supplements his income with his art. All proceeds from his art help to support Larime and his disabled artist wife, Danielle.

Larime draws with his mouth on a Wacom Cintiq tablet generously provided by Wacom. All artwork is digital – there are no ‘original’ or ‘hardcopy’ versions – and finished art is provided in hi-res, print-ready .TIF format.

He has limited access to video, so has no video to share at this time. You can see his art at http://larimetaylor.com/?page_id=7

What We Need & What You Get

All pledges will go towards the purchase of things Larime needs to better his life and improve his art. Stylus pens for his Wacom tablet, more RAM for his computer, a better video card, stock photos for referencing - it's all related to helping him be a successful artist and get off of Social Security. 

Anything over his art needs will go to towards buying clothing and household items Larime desperately needs for his family as they live below the poverty line.

Perks will be art, all drawn by Larime.

The Impact

This is about helping me become self-sufficient, helping me live a better life, and helping me to be able to provide more or my family. This is, bluntly, about changing my world and helping me get out of poverty on my own skills and talents.

I have a successful Kickstarter campaign for a comic book I'm trying to make, but those funds are strictly for paying the production costs and shipping of rewards. This is a general plea to improve my life and my art.

Other Ways You Can Help

Just spreading the word can help. Thank you all for your encouragement!

story:
Samavesha, a non-profit performing arts organization, is excited to invite your participation in Art in Nature: The Nature of Art Festival, a community based, free multidisciplinary, outdoor event that takes people of all ages on a journey through the wonders of art and the environment—leaving participants with a greater connection to art, nature, and one another.

The challenges of putting together such an extraordinary festival are numerous and varied. We rely on the generosity of our donors and our volunteers to be able to share this event with all members of the community regardless of their financial situation.
The festival is wheelchair accessible, admission is free, there are no vendors, and nothing is sold at the sites. Just an immersion into art and nature.

Our mission in producing the Art in Nature Festival is to utilize the power of nature and art to bring people closer together, to draw out our innate creativity, to provide a model for collaborative, innovative action, and to inspire future generations.
We are optimistic that the social, economic, and environmental challenges are surmountable through creative collective action. We believe art is a gift to be shared with everyone, just like nature shares her beauty with us all.

Art in Nature Festival will be held on September 23rd along the Stream Trail of Redwood Regional Park in Oakland, California. It will feature live music, dance, theater, martial arts, circus arts, sculpture, painting, photography, poetry, kids' activities, and other visual and performing arts.

Art in Nature: The Nature of Art Festival will take artists and community members on an interactive journey. As participants move along the Stream Trail, they will experience participatory art that is in relationship with the natural world, and the creative process of the artists as well as discover many diverse live performances among the meadows, redwoods, ancient oaks and historic sites.

As you can imagine, hosting a FREE event is a challenge in these times. There are permits we need to buy, there is insurance we need to purchase, and there are basic expenses that are unavoidable. Not to mention the thousands of hours that go into creating the event. How, then, can we make the Festival happen? With a huge amount of donated time and effort on behalf of the Samavesha team, volunteers, and all the artists involved. But that is not enough. The other way we can make this happen is by your kind generosity. 

If you are passionate about supporting the arts and wish to see events like this happen in your community, this is a good occasion to make a contribution!

A few of the participants at Art in Nature / The Nature of Art Festival include:
Sarah Cahill, Luciano Chessa, Pauchi Sasaki, Michelle Fletcher, Elizabeth Boubion, Bar Shacterman, Zach Pine, Carter Brooks, Ragged Wing Ensemble, Richard K. Bacon, Bret Arenson, Dante Mancini, Here Now Dance Collective, Red Start Studio, Alicia Dattner, Evan Fraser, Rene’ Jenkins, Adrian Arias, Laura Inserra, Charles Ekabhumi Ellik, Claudia Anfuso, Oakland Improv Collective, Quantum Martial Arts, Elektra Schmidt, Alan Tower, Rafael Jesús González, Sam Rogers, and way more...
For a full list please visit the website: http://www.artinnaturefestival.org/Artists.html

For more info and pictures, please visit the website: www.artinnaturefestival.org
story_txt:
Samavesha, a non-profit performing arts organization, is excited to invite your participation in Art in Nature: The Nature of Art Festival, a community based, free multidisciplinary, outdoor event that takes people of all ages on a journey through the wonders of art and the environment—leaving participants with a greater connection to art, nature, and one another.
The challenges of putting together such an extraordinary festival are numerous and varied. We rely on the generosity of our donors and our volunteers to be able to share this event with all members of the community regardless of their financial situation. The festival is wheelchair accessible, admission is free, there are no vendors, and nothing is sold at the sites. Just an immersion into art and nature.
Our mission in producing the Art in Nature Festival is to utilize the power of nature and art to bring people closer together, to draw out our innate creativity, to provide a model for collaborative, innovative action, and to inspire future generations.We are optimistic that the social, economic, and environmental challenges are surmountable through creative collective action. We believe art is a gift to be shared with everyone, just like nature shares her beauty with us all.

story:
Short Summary

Tieme de Waard is a young adventurer from Zwolle, The Netherlands. He has spent most his life traveling Europe and Asia, but has now set his mind on the renovation of a 1941 wooden fisherman's ship. Merlan. Tieme funds it by working as a carpenter, but his finances are running low and the ship is still not ready for the winter. Due to the financial crisis, there is not a lot of work for him and all the time he spends on making money, the renovation stagnates.

To me, it is clear that Tieme will need a lot more money to be able to ever finish the renovation. He has been working on it for a year now, and came quite a long way, but it will still take a lot of work and effort to bring the ship back to the state it deserves.

What We Need & What You Get

The project needs about $10.000 to finish. This will be spent on the fundamental construction of the ship, as well as the realization of new interior. Even if the goal amount of money won't be realized, all money funded will go to the renovation of the ship!

The Impact

Merlan is one of a few 1940's wooden trawlers still sailing. Tieme his plan is to sail Merlan across the entire globe. Showing the impact of one man's effort and the ability to realize your dreams, as long as you stay persistent and do what has to be done.

It is an inspiring story. This is why during the renovation and during the travels following it, I will be making a documentary about him and his perseverance concerning this project. Because I know it will be difficult and I hope to be able to document the struggle and the triumph he will experience.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t donate money, but that doesn’t mean they can’t contribute:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

  • Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you for your effort,

Daan van de Konijnenburg

story:
Stree2lab is a research and design lab focusing on documenting the activity of urban art in the contemporary city and cultivating the interest and awareness of the importance of this art in the community.

BToy

Urban art in Barcelona has a style and an original approach based on the social and political history, the result also of a social and artistic miscegenation and of the progressive corralling of the legislation regarding it.

C215

We begin from the idea that the contemporary city, with its many expressions of urban art, is an open air gallery, consistent with the times we live and the way we process information today.

Our aim is to raise awareness of the city's public gallery. To achieve this, we have created an online catalog of cities with unique urban art, including maps documenting the location of the most original street art, with detailed files for each piece tagged by artist, date, and other identifying elements (medium, materials, etc).

Want to know who created your favourite piece of graffiti and where their other work is? Stree2lab is the place to come.

Stree2lab.com

We also want to suggest relevant urban art walkabouts in each city, to help raise awareness of this important artistic and urban landscape. The catalogs would be accessible from any internet connected device (desktop version and mobile application version).

With this platform we can support urban artists, sharing their art with the world.

Detailed files for each piece tagged by artist, date, and other identifying elements (medium, materials, etc)

With Stree2lab we also aim to reinvest socially what we may acquire from the platform. We want Stree2lab to become a reference point for street artists, both virtually and personally. That is why we expect to organize an annual urban art festival in public spaces, with guest artists, technical workshops, presentations and discussions.

Innovation

We embarked on this journey because of the desire to work with art and public space. Hundreds of books already exist about street art, but there are very few geographical and categorized documentations, much less a platform like the one we propose.

We believe in the strength of urban art as an authentic contemporary art form and what it brings to the city today, and the importance of documenting this movement to help recognize the due value of a work that often mixes social activism and social inconformity with creativity in beautiful public gestures.

Why Indiegogo?

As researchers and designers of public space, exploring the city and creating the platform is a strong investment in hours.

Indiegogo can help fund the programming platform, improving its usability and function and applying it to mobile devices, in addition to a hosting and a data protection plan, necessary for the creation of databases such as ours. This way, we can offer a completely free platform for the consumer.

Rewards
An exclusive Keith Haring poster illustration designed by Stree2lab
 

Launching

Stree2lab will be released in December. If the project is funded, we will work hard to package, number and ship every individuals order so that they will have their awards before by December 22th. Just in time for you to wrap them up for Christmas!

Where the Indiegogo Money Will Be Used

- Web programming hours
- Web designing hours
- Hosting
- Data protection plan

- Indiegogo fees
- Backers rewards
- Packaging
- Basic shipping costs

International Shipping:
$5 rewards, shipping is on us.
$10 + 15 + $25 rewards, add $2.
$50 rewards, add $5.
$135 rewards, add $10.

Other ways you can help

If you just can’t contribute, don't worry. You can help us spreading the project by social networks using the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you!

story:
What is Impermanence?

Impermanence is the tenth original collaborative performance presented by Art as Action on November 9-10 at The Dairy Performance Space in Boulder, CO. A collage of diverse art genres and performer’s backgrounds, experiences and ideas, Impermanence will be entertaining, thought provoking and inspiring by inviting performers and audience members to reflect on the tension between holding on and letting go – a common human experience at the root of many exhilarating and/or painful events throughout life.

What is the Artivist Process?

An inherent part of Art as Action performances is the Artivist Process. At our monthly Artivist Sessions, contributing Artivists come together and present their pieces in-progress. Participants offer constructive feedback that provides opportunities for discussion, debate, discovery and brainstorming.

Art as Action performances bring together members of various art communities and allow artists the opportunity to collaborate and transcend the boundaries between art genres. This Artivist Process impacts artists and audience members alike by showcasing unique, creative perspectives on the human experience, prominent social issues, and artistic themes in everyday life.

There are so many worthy causes – why should I put my precious dollars into Art as Action? 

In a world that is constantly changing, art remains a proven and eternal source of human inspiration, expression and connection.  Your donation to Art as Action:

  • inspires art
  • promotes community
  • makes collaboration possible
  • enables innovation
  • supports a growing organization with a growing impact
  • makes you a crucial partner in the powerful Artivist Movement

Art as Action has a 10-year history of successful productions.  Impermanence will be our most innovative, creative, diverse and collaborative show to date.

What will my donation go toward?

Our annual budget is $27,000 and the production of Impermanence is a large part of that.  The funds from this campaign will go toward:

  • Renting The Dairy Center Performance Space for one weekend of performances: $3,000
  • Renting studio space for Artivist Sessions and rehearsals: $1,200
  • Hiring a professional Lighting Designer: $500
  • Printing Posters, Postcards and Playbills: $300

The Mission of Art as Action

Art as Action utilizes the performing arts to develop an inclusive community by facilitating a collaborative creative process that inspires artists to express, explore and embrace their humanity and the humanity of others. This community and process are designed to include a broader community through public performances and instructional classes.

THANK YOU FOR JOINING THE ARTIVIST MOVEMENT AND SUPPORTING ART AS ACTION!
Your financial support enables us to pay our bills, and your faith in us inspires us to do great work.

www.artasaction.org

IMPERMANENCE PERFORMERS: Katie Anhalt, Taylor Bratches, Laura Brower, Dave Crotser, Annabelle Denmark, Chloe DiVita, Lyndsey Eberley, Wayne Gilbert, Austin Goodman, Joy Jackson, Shirley Lammers, Lo Larocque, Jan Leversee, Sarah Leversee, Darrin Martin, Erica Martin, Annie Piatt, Emily Piatt Edwards, Joe Ramas, Elizabeth Reicks, Steph Roundeau, Jasmine Saraswati, Shannon Sawyer, Andy Snyders, Jackie Snyders, Nadja Tizer, Fallon Voorheis, Tomas Waples, Molly Wilson, Marci Wojciechowski

ARTISTIC DIRECTOR: Sarah Leversee

TECHNICAL DIRECTOR: Dave Crotser

BOARD OF DIRECTORS: Joy Jackson, President; Wayne Gilbert, Vice President; Chloe DiVita, Treasurer; Tom Collins; Yvonne DiVita; Annie Piatt

PHOTO: (c) Annabelle Denmark Photography

story:
Our Story

ebraiding.net / eNaturals.net is working on the "Women Empowered" Project to put disadvantaged women in Africa through a Braiding School for an intensive braiding curriculum. After the successful completion of the program, they will be eligible for an advanced training program with our organization in the United States. The first school is in Dakar, Senegal and we are hoping to have the first graduating class in April 2012. Will follow schools in Cotonou, Benin, Abidjan, Ivory Coast, Bamako, Mali, Conakry, Guinee, Accra, Ghana, Monrovia, Liberia, etc..

In recognition of the organization's effort in the hair braiding and natural hair care industry, two of its executive members received the 2011 SELF IMAGE Awards as industry Leaders who have given training, employment, self love and empowerment to men and women.

 

The Impact

A critical aspect of promoting gender equality is the empowerment of women, with a focus on identifying and redressing power imbalances and giving women more autonomy to manage their own lives. Women's empowerment is vital to sustainable development and the realization of human rights for all.

The project will help disadvantaged women acquired a skill. Thus, assuring a certain level of economic independence with a number of skilled women workers getting out of poverty.

The contributions are needed for educational, travel, and housing expenses, immigration and legal expenses.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise at least $30,000 to start the project. The first location is Dakar, Senegal, and we will extend to the other African capital cities.

When you pledge $25 or more, we will send you a special "Thank You" note from the organization Executives

When you pledge $100 or more you will receive a paperback copy of the 4th Volume of the SANATA Interantional Braiding and Natural Hair Care Magazine published by ebraiding.net

When you pledge $250 or more you will receive a VIP ticket for the 5th Annual SANATA Magazine Premiere to celebrate the 5th Anniversary of the Publication

When you pledge $500 or more, your name will be listed in the SANATA International Braiding and Natural Hair Care Magazine.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with anyone you know.

story:
Fact & Fiction

The stories we learn about individuals--whether they be historical or taken from recent headlines--can be incomplete narratives. We learn facts and statistics, or sensationalized intimate details that are used to push an agenda or to sell interest in a publication. Since we are so fond of colorful stories, I thought it would be interesting if the events that describe non-fictional characters were actually taken from fiction. For example, using part of the prologue from Ralph Ellison's "Invisible Man" (where the character is describing his frustration of not being seen) with the image of Martin Luther King Jr.'s assassin, James Earl Ray, provides a method of insight into an otherwise incomprehensible mind.  Another image from this proposed series is that of a child soldier with text from the "Lord of the Flies", a story where children established their own laws and advantages of a newly established civilization. Using these fictional stories is not meant for entertainment. These classic tales of the imagination are tools that frame these individuals as human beings who made decisions and may have been forced into events that we would all find challenging . The fiction is meant to establish empathy and invite introspection upon the actions of these persons.  Knowledge is not a mere quantity--it also permits a quality of understanding to be cherished and shared.

-- Rodney Ewing

 

Words from the curator of USSSA:

"I wish I had Rodney as an art instructor when I was growing up.  He is living proof that the arts are not just an industry to make things "look cool" or to fool you into buying something.  His work compels me.  I marvel at his technique and in a matter of moments I realize--I am immersed in feelings--I have connected with the character in his work.  I find myself relating to an image."

Rodney is an emerging artist to watch--his work has reached a sophistication in recent years that has much to teach us about moving into the 21st century.  Early in our conversations, Rodney and I aligned over an interest in Howard Zinn's seminal work "A People's History of the United States."  I noticed that in addition to being an artist, Rodney is an eclectic historian. He has learned his lessons from books, both fact and fiction, as well as from the stories of the people in his own life.  At one point in our conversation he sounds like a psychologist and, at another, he becomes a social theorist.  In all cases, he is a wondrous human being.  He has learned from the best and the worst of the decades behind us and what may be strictly political for some, is grounded in human experience for Rodney."

As my child grows up, I would love for Rodney to teach him how to draw; how to see the world through another person's eyes, how to appreciate the values and beliefs of "the other," and to learn that mere tolerance is of no benefit to the profound lessons yet to be learned through genuine empathy and respect."

-- m. ryan noble

 

How your donation will help:

Rodney's drawings for USSSA are some of the best examples of the human condition put onto paper.  The subjects include child soldiers and the despair of the assassin mind.  Sadly, these perspectives have not fallen to be obsolete but may in fact be more relevant than ever.  These large drawings will be installed back-to-back and hang from the ceiling such that viewers can witness these art works from either side and from more than one perspective.  Your donation will help afford the materials, shipping, and hardware for the installation of his work.  Any funds beyond his goal will provide Rodney with transportation to promote the USSSA in a town near you!

As an artist with a growing reputation, Rodney's prints are sure to be an attractive perk and a keen investment.  Please share Rodney's project with anyone you know who supports the arts or, more simply, a compassion for others.

        

USSSA

http://www.facebook.com/USSSartists

Thirteen contemporary artists will be forming “a more perfect union” in the month leading up to the Presidential Election, 2012. The project, “USSSA (united secret society of subversive artists),” will feature a highly diverse group of artists; all politically invested in the arts. They are educators, activists and organizers. The artists of USSSA will each create an installation around a theme of her or his choice. Through innovations to the curatorial model, this project becomes a venture where each artist presents a personally relevant perspective and engages the project as a space to work toward equal terms of support, respect and resolution. In bringing a collective voice to the issues that are most important to us, this group of artists will be calling attention to the dynamics of democratic process, documenting our innovative forms of collaboration, and bringing form to the patterns of real and actual change.

 

More USSSA campaigns

Please also visit the campaign page for fellow artist, Christy Speakman.  Her project "Watershed" allows supporters to explore the vanishing Louisiana wetlands through interactive technology.  Thank you for supporting the artists of USSSA!

http://www.indiegogo.com/USSSA-ChristySpeakman
